summary: India's apparent policy contradictions, such as import restrictions on electronics despite efforts to attract foreign investment, are complicating the market for global investors. While Prime Minister Modi's "Make in India" initiative and production-linked incentives aim to boost domestic manufacturing and attract companies like Apple and Foxconn, protectionist measures and capital controls create uncertainty. These challenges exist even as India seeks to enhance its global reputation and capitalize on shifting geopolitical alliances and supply chain diversification away from China, potentially limiting its full economic growth and investment appeal.

title: Everything Apple Plans to Show on Sept. 12: iPhone 15, Watches, AirPods
summary: Apple Inc. is set to unveil its latest products on September 12, including the iPhone 15 line, new smartwatches, and the latest AirPods. The event is expected to highlight the titanium iPhone 15 Pro, camera improvements, a switch to USB-C chargers, and faster smartwatches. This launch represents Apple's most significant new product unveiling of the year.

title: If You Like SPHQ, Check Out Quality ETFs XMHQ and XSHQ
summary: The article highlights the growing popularity of quality ETFs, specifically discussing the Invesco S&P 500 Quality ETF (SPHQ) and suggesting that investors also consider mid-cap and small-cap quality ETFs like XMHQ and XSHQ for broader exposure. It emphasizes that quality factors are significant across all market capitalizations and details how these Invesco funds select their holdings based on quality scores. The piece also provides insights into the AUM and recent inflows for each ETF, noting the key differences and similarities in how they track quality within their respective market segments.

title: History of Apple in Photos, From Steve Jobs Era to $3 Trillion
summary: This article chronicles the history of Apple, from its founding by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak to its recent achievement of a $3 trillion market cap under Tim Cook. It details key product launches like the Apple II, Macintosh, iPod, and iPhone, as well as leadership changes and challenges such as the recent DOJ lawsuit and declining iPhone sales in China. The article also touches upon Apple's expansion into services and new product categories like the Apple Watch and Vision Pro, alongside its pivot towards generative AI.

title: Qualcomm will make Apple’s iPhone modems until 2026, and its stock surges
summary: Qualcomm Inc. will continue to supply modem chips for Apple Inc.’s iPhones until at least 2026. This extended partnership suggests Apple's efforts to develop its own 5G modem chips are progressing slower than anticipated. Following the announcement, Qualcomm's stock (QCOM) experienced a significant surge of approximately 4%.

title: Qualcomm to supply Apple Inc with 5G chips until 2026 under new deal
summary: Qualcomm has signed a new deal with Apple to supply 5G chips for iPhones until at least 2026, extending their previous agreement which was set to expire this year. While the financial terms are similar to the prior deal, Qualcomm's financial projections assume that only 20% of iPhones will use its chips by 2026, as Apple continues to develop its own modem technology. A patent licensing deal between the companies, signed in 2019, remains in place and could be extended beyond its 2025 expiration.

title: Apple unveils iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max
summary: Apple has unveiled the iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max, featuring a strong and lightweight titanium design, a new customizable Action button, significant camera upgrades, and the A17 Pro chip for enhanced performance and gaming. The new models also support USB-C with faster speeds and introduce new safety features like Roadside Assistance via satellite. Pre-orders begin September 15, with availability starting September 22.

title: Apple unveils its first carbon neutral products
summary: Apple announced its first carbon neutral products, primarily the new Apple Watch lineup, marking significant progress towards its Apple 2030 goal of making every product carbon neutral. The company detailed innovations in design, clean energy use in manufacturing and product use, reduced transportation emissions, and the development of new materials like FineWoven which replaces leather. Apple also introduced a new tool called Grid Forecast to help users choose cleaner energy times for electricity consumption.

title: Arm, the Chip Designer, Raises $4.87 Billion in the Year’s Largest I.P.O. (Published 2023)
summary: Arm, the British chip design company, successfully raised $4.87 billion in the largest initial public offering of the year, valuing the company at $54.5 billion. This I.P.O. is a significant event for SoftBank, which acquired Arm in 2016 and aims to capitalize on the tech industry's focus on artificial intelligence, following a failed acquisition bid by Nvidia. Arm's return to public markets under the ticker symbol ARM is being closely watched as a gauge of investor interest in new tech offerings.

title: Arm climbs 25% in Nasdaq debut after pricing IPO at $51 a share
summary: Arm Holdings saw its stock jump nearly 25% on its first day of trading on the Nasdaq after pricing its IPO at $51 per share, valuing the company at almost $60 billion. SoftBank, which took Arm private in 2016, retains about 90% of the company's outstanding shares. Despite its high valuation relative to its current growth, Arm's unique royalty-based business model, including revenue from decades-old designs, and its strategic importance in AI and chip design, are key factors in investor interest.

title: Apple: Streamlining Sustainability For Every Buyer's Perfect Product
summary: Apple is prioritizing sustainability, aiming for all products to be carbon-neutral by 2030, a goal already achieved by the Apple Watch. The company's strategy involves significant emission reductions, increased use of renewable energy, and incorporating recycled materials, ensuring sustainability without compromising product features for consumers. Apple seeks to lead the tech industry towards a more responsible and environmentally conscious future.

title: Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS), including its current stock price, key statistics like PE Ratio and Dividend Yield, and its top holdings as of August 31, 2025. The ETF has a portfolio value of $8.44 billion with top holdings including NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta Platforms. It also presents historical performance data and breakdowns of asset allocation and sector exposure.

title: Equal Weight ETF EQL Hits Key Buy Signal
summary: The article highlights the Alps Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL) as an intriguing tool to mitigate concentration risk in the S&P 500, particularly due to the dominance of a few tech firms. EQL, an equal-weight ETF, assigns equal weight to each sector and then to stocks within those sectors, offering diversification and strong performance. The fund hit a key buy signal as its price rose above its 50-day simple moving average.

title: I Can't Stop Thinking About How Awkward Apple's 'Mother Nature' Ad Was, and I Finally Figured Out Why
summary: The author discusses Apple's "Mother Nature" ad featuring Octavia Spencer and Tim Cook, which aired during the iPhone keynote. While initially perceived as cringe-worthy and unfunny, the author concludes that the ad was effective in highlighting Apple's environmental efforts and contrasting them with competitors, even if it wasn't a comedic success. The ad addressed skepticism about Apple's carbon-neutral goals, particularly regarding the use of carbon credits, by having the "Mother Nature" character voice those criticisms.

title: iShares MSCI ACWI ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI ACWI ETF (ACWI) offers investors global equity exposure to large and mid-capitalization developed and emerging markets. It tracks the MSCI All Country World Index, providing diversification across numerous countries and sectors efficiently. The ETF is marketed as a low-cost investment vehicle with potential for long-term growth, though it acknowledges inherent investment risks.

title: Expedia Group builds generative AI into multiple products in its “Fall Release”
summary: Expedia Group is unveiling its "Fall Release 2023," introducing numerous features and products for travelers and supplier partners, heavily integrating generative AI. Key updates include AI-powered conversational capabilities within its apps, dynamic travel guides, and "EG Labs" for consumer feedback on new tech. The release also brings influencer content, group trip planning tools, and AI-driven recommendations for hotel partners to enhance performance and guest insights.

title: Calix taps Jabil as part of $42B+ broadband manufacturing plan
summary: Jabil, a St. Petersburg-based tech company, is partnering with California-based Calix Inc. to manufacture parts for expanding broadband internet service in rural America. This collaboration is part of the Biden Administration's $42.45 billion Build America, Buy America (BABA) effort for the Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment (BEAD) program. Jabil will produce Calix’s optical network terminals (ONTs) and optical line terminals (OLTs) in Michigan, creating over 100 new jobs.

title: Buy the Dip in Apple, or Has the Trend Turned Rotten?
summary: This article discusses whether investors should "buy the dip" in Apple (AAPL) given its recent revenue decline for three consecutive quarters and concerns about its position in the AI race. It highlights Direxion's leveraged and inverse single-stock ETFs for AAPL (AAPD and AAPU) and broader technology ETFs (TECL and TECS) for traders with varying risk appetites and market outlooks. The article also provides important disclaimers regarding the risks associated with leveraged and inverse ETFs.

title: Should Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: This article evaluates the Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) as a potential investment, highlighting its focus on large-cap growth stocks, low expense ratio, and strong performance. It details VONG's sector exposure, top holdings, and risk profile, while also suggesting alternative ETFs for consideration.

title: Qualcomm defeats consumers' antitrust claims over chip supply contracts
summary: Qualcomm has successfully defeated a consumer antitrust lawsuit in California federal court, which alleged that the chipmaker's contracts with device manufacturers artificially inflated mobile phone costs. U.S. District Judge Jacqueline Scott Corley ruled in favor of Qualcomm, stating that allowing the plaintiffs to revive past evidence would lead to prolonged and expensive "do-over litigation." This ruling follows Qualcomm's 2020 victory against a similar lawsuit brought by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission.

title: Apple is ordered to face Apple Pay antitrust lawsuit
summary: Apple has been ordered to face a private antitrust lawsuit brought by payment card issuers. The lawsuit alleges that Apple exerts a 100% monopoly over the domestic market for tap-and-pay wallets on its devices, forcing banks to pay excessive fees and hindering competition and innovation. A U.S. District Judge dismissed a "tying" claim but ruled that plaintiffs could proceed with their claim that Apple violated federal antitrust law.

title: Dutch regulator rejects Apple’s objections to fines
summary: The Dutch competition watchdog ACM has rejected Apple's objections to 50 million euros ($53 million) in fines. The fines were imposed because Apple failed to fully comply with orders to allow alternative payment methods for dating apps in the Netherlands. Apple plans to appeal the decision to the Netherlands courts, maintaining that the original order degrades investment incentives and compromises user privacy and data security.

title: Moat Investing Rises Above Magnificent Seven Dominance
summary: The article discusses how Morningstar's Moat Index outperformed the S&P 500 year-to-date despite being underweight the "Magnificent Seven" mega-cap stocks. It highlights the growing concentration risk posed by these seven technology giants and explains how equal-weighted Moat strategies offer a solution through diversification and attractive valuations. The article also details the September index reconstitutions for both the Moat and SMID Moat Indexes, noting shifts away from growth stocks and into more value-oriented sectors.

title: Qualcomm layoffs in 2023: Why 1,258 jobs are being slashed
summary: Qualcomm is laying off 1,258 employees in California due to a slump in smartphone sales and a prior commitment to cost-cutting. The layoffs, primarily impacting engineering teams in San Diego and Santa Clara, represent 2.5% of its global workforce. The company is trying to diversify into new markets like IoT, VR, and automotive chips, but its revenue continues to be heavily reliant on the struggling smartphone market.

title: IWF ETF: Be Cautious Of High Valuations (NYSEARCA:IWF)
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) tracks large-cap U.S. growth stocks and has its largest holdings in Apple and Microsoft. While it generally underperformed some growth ETFs like QQQ, it surpassed others like SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 Growth ETF due to differences in its holdings and sector exposure. The article advises caution due to potentially high valuations.

title: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is largely controlled by institutional shareholders who own 55% of the company
summary: Institutional shareholders control 55% of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), giving them significant influence over the company's share price. The top 25 shareholders own 40% of the company, with The Vanguard Group, Inc. being the largest at 8.3%. Individual investors and public companies hold 39% and 5.9% respectively, while insiders own less than 1%.

title: Nvidia to take on Intel, Qualcomm with Arm-based processors for PC; availability pegged for 2025
summary: Nvidia is developing Arm-based processors for personal computers, aiming to compete with Intel and Qualcomm, with availability expected as soon as 2025. This move intensifies competition in the PC chip market, especially as AMD is also reportedly working on Arm-based processors for PCs. The initiative follows Apple's successful transition to in-house Arm-based chips, boosting Mac sales, and poses a significant challenge to Intel's dominant position.

title: FDA Clears Omnipod 5 App for iPhones
summary: The FDA has granted 510(k) Clearance to the Omnipod 5 app for iPhone, making Insulet Corporation the first to offer a tubeless AID system with full control from compatible Android and iOS smartphones. This clearance follows the Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery system's initial FDA clearance for patients aged 6 years and older with type 1 diabetes in January 2022, and subsequent approval for children aged 2 years and older. The iOS app will offer the same functionality as the Android version, plus a new custom food feature, with a full market release expected in 2024.

title: ‘Fundamental rethink:’ Investors dump China shares despite new efforts to shore up the economy
summary: Global investors are offloading Chinese shares at an "unprecedented" rate due to concerns over China's economic slowdown, a lack of convincing policy responses, and an opaque business environment. Despite Beijing's efforts to stimulate growth through bond issuance and sovereign wealth fund purchases, these measures have failed to restore investor confidence. Experts suggest that a fundamental rethinking of China investment is underway, driven by a collapse of trust in the Chinese Communist Party and rising US-China tensions.

title: Apple unveils M3, M3 Pro, and M3 Max, the most advanced chips for a personal computer
summary: Apple announced its new M3, M3 Pro, and M3 Max chips, touting them as the most advanced chips for a personal computer. Built on 3-nanometer process technology, these chips introduce a next-generation GPU architecture with features like Dynamic Caching, hardware-accelerated ray tracing, and mesh shading, delivering significant performance improvements over the M1 family of chips. The M3 family also boasts faster CPU performance, an enhanced Neural Engine for AI/ML tasks, and an unrivaled unified memory architecture supporting up to 128GB, along with improved power efficiency for longer battery life and a reduced environmental impact.

title: MOAT: History May Not Repeat Itself (BATS:MOAT)
summary: The VanEck Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) has a strong historical track record and reasonable fees but is significantly underweight in big tech. Given a bullish view on big tech, the author suggests MOAT may underperform the S&P 500 going forward. The article provides an overview of the ETF's strategy and the author's financial disclosures.

title: DarioHealth launches smart blood sugar meter for iPhone 15
summary: DarioHealth has launched a new smart blood sugar meter specifically designed for Apple iPhone 15 users. This new device leverages the iPhone 15's USB-C charging port for real-time data capture and instant connectivity, enhancing the personalized DarioHealth management experience. The company aims to innovate and continuously engage members in managing chronic conditions like diabetes.

title: Apple now has $162 billion in cash on hand, slightly less than last quarter
summary: Apple's cash reserves decreased slightly to $162.1 billion in its fiscal fourth quarter, down from $166.5 billion in the previous quarter. This comes as the company maintained one of the largest cash piles in the U.S. and posted revenue of $89.50 billion, exceeding Wall Street expectations despite analysts predicting a fourth consecutive quarter of revenue decline.

title: 'We're Changing the Structure:' GM's Software Boss Steps Down Amid Major Overhaul
summary: General Motors is reorganizing its software and services engineering team, leading to the departure of former Apple executive Dave Richardson, who was VP of software and services engineering. Sterling Anderson, GM's chief product officer, will now oversee vehicle software engineering and Global Product. This change aims to accelerate the development and delivery of technology experiences as GM prepares to launch a new centralized computer system in 2028 and moves away from phone mirroring in future vehicles.

title: On-device AI chips: New battleground for chipmakers
summary: Global chipmakers like Samsung Electronics, Qualcomm, Intel, and AMD are intensifying their focus on on-device AI chips for smartphones, laptops, and PCs, recognizing its potential for customized services, lower costs, and enhanced privacy compared to generative AI. This shift is expected to drive significant growth in AI-enabled consumer electronics and contribute to rising memory chip prices. Both on-device AI and generative AI are seen as complementary, with companies like Samsung planning to integrate both into future smart devices.

title: Why Warren Buffett has done more to educate investors than any other corporate executive
summary: Warren Buffett, CEO of Berkshire Hathaway and a prominent figure on the MarketWatch 50 list, is recognized for his significant influence on investors. He is known for his candid communication, explaining complex business operations, and openly discussing his successes and failures, which has made him an exceptional educator in the investment world.

title: Why Warren Buffett has done more to educate investors than any other corporate executive
summary: Warren Buffett is recognized not only for his success as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway and his strategic investments in companies like Apple and Occidental Petroleum, but also for his exceptional candor with investors. The article highlights his significant role in educating investors about the intricacies of businesses and his willingness to discuss both successes and mistakes. This transparency sets him apart, making his biggest legacy potentially his contribution to investor education.

title: Apple agrees to $25 million settlement with US over hiring of immigrants
summary: Apple Inc. has agreed to pay $25 million to settle claims by the U.S. Department of Justice that it illegally favored immigrant workers over U.S. citizens and green card holders for certain jobs. The Justice Department stated that Apple did not recruit U.S. citizens or permanent residents for jobs eligible for a federal program allowing employers to sponsor immigrant workers for green cards. This settlement marks the largest ever for the Justice Department concerning discrimination based on citizenship.

title: Booking.com settles Italian tax dispute with 94-million euro payment
summary: Travel website Booking.com has agreed to pay approximately 94 million euros ($100.25 million) to settle a tax dispute in Italy covering the period from 2013 to 2021. The settlement follows an investigation by Genoa prosecutors into the company's handling of VAT on properties rented through its platform. As part of the agreement, Booking.com also filed its VAT return in Italy for 2022 and committed to acting as a tax substitute for transactions with private individuals not registered for VAT.

title: FAANG Gives Way to the ‘Magnificent Seven’
summary: The "FAANG" stock group has evolved into the "Magnificent Seven," with Netflix replaced by Nvidia, and Microsoft and Tesla added to the mix of top U.S. market names. ETF issuers are beginning to launch products specifically targeting these seven stocks, while existing ETFs like the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK) already hold significant concentrations of them. Investors have various options, from highly concentrated ETFs to diversified funds, to gain exposure to these influential companies.

title: Spotlight on illegal hiring practices: Apple pays $25M for recruiting, job ad mistakes
summary: Apple Inc. has agreed to pay $25 million to settle allegations of illegal hiring practices related to its PERM program. A DOJ investigation found Apple failed to recruit U.S. citizens or green card holders, did not advertise these positions on its external website, and required paper applications for PERM jobs while allowing electronic applications for others. The settlement includes $18.25 million for discrimination victims and $6.75 million for civil penalties, with Apple also agreeing to revise its recruitment practices and provide employee training.

title: FMR LLC Acquires New Stake in Magenta Therapeutics Inc
summary: FMR LLC, through its flagship company Fidelity Investments, has acquired a new stake in Magenta Therapeutics Inc (MGTA) by purchasing 2,218,212 shares at $0.6996 per share. This transaction gives FMR LLC a 14.97% ownership stake in the clinical-stage biotechnology company, indicating a strategic investment aligning with the firm's focus on technology and healthcare sectors. Despite Magenta Therapeutics currently operating at a loss, FMR LLC's move suggests a belief in the company's long-term value and transformative potential in stem cell and gene therapy.

title: Warren Buffet's latest buys and sells
summary: This article details Berkshire Hathaway's latest stock buys and sells from its third-quarter 2023 13F filing, highlighting that the company was a net seller despite a tough market quarter, leading to a record cash stake. It identifies three undervalued Warren Buffett stocks within Berkshire Hathaway’s portfolio—Bank of America, American Express, and Kraft Heinz—providing Morningstar's analysis and key metrics for each. The piece also lists the stocks Berkshire Hathaway sold entirely, including Activision Blizzard, Celanese, General Motors, Johnson & Johnson, Mondelez International, Procter & Gamble, and United Parcel Service, while noting a significant reduction in its Chevron holdings.

title: Apple’s In-House Technologies Team Still Has Plenty of Work to Do
summary: This article discusses Apple's intensive efforts to design and manufacture its own core hardware components, such as cameras, screens, modems, and batteries, for its products. It also touches on Apple's adoption of the RCS texting standard, the revelation of its revenue share from the Google search deal, and a key health executive's move to Oura. The piece highlights that Apple's in-house technologies team has extensive work ahead in its strategic initiative to control major parts of its devices.

title: Venmo, Cash App users sue Apple over peer-to-peer payment fees
summary: Venmo and Cash App customers have filed a proposed class-action lawsuit against Apple Inc. alleging the company abused its market power in mobile peer-to-peer payments, leading to "rapidly inflating prices." The lawsuit claims Apple's agreements with PayPal's Venmo and Block's Cash App violate U.S. antitrust law by limiting "feature competition," including prohibiting decentralized cryptocurrency technology. This case adds to Apple's ongoing antitrust legal challenges, seeking an injunction that could force Apple to divest or segregate its Apple Cash business.

title: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF With the Nasdaq At An All-Time High? History Offers a Clear Answer.
summary: This article discusses the Invesco QQQ ETF and whether it's a good investment despite the Nasdaq Composite being at an all-time high. It analyzes historical data of the Nasdaq's performance after reaching new highs, suggesting that further gains are common. The article concludes that dollar-cost averaging into QQQ is a sensible strategy regardless of market highs, as it tracks the Nasdaq 100 which tends to rise over time.

title: Gaming Industry Charts a Rebound in 2023
summary: The gaming industry is experiencing a significant rebound in 2023 driven by strong console sales, new game releases, and innovations in mobile and cloud gaming. This recovery, following a dip in 2022, is further supported by anticipation of increased M&A activity and strategic moves by major players like Microsoft, Apple, and Netflix, positioning the sector for continued growth into 2024. The article highlights strong U.S. sales, hardware as a primary catalyst, and key factors like M&A and technological advancements shaping the industry's future trajectory.

title: Sonos Readies $400-Plus Headphones to Rival Apple and Bose, TV Set-Top Box
summary: Sonos Inc. is planning a significant expansion into new product categories, including headphones priced over $400 and a TV set-top box. These new offerings are expected to compete with products from Apple, Bose, and Roku, marking a strategic move beyond its traditional smart speakers and sound bars. The headphones could launch as early as April, with the set-top box following by the end of 2024.

title: Department of Justice and Apple Reach $25 Million Landmark Agreement
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice announced a $25 million agreement with Apple Inc. to resolve allegations of discriminatory hiring practices related to the permanent labor certification (PERM) program. Apple's recruitment practices for PERM positions, which included not advertising on its public-facing career website and requiring mailed paper applications, deterred U.S. workers. The settlement includes $6.75 million in civil penalties and $18.25 million for a backpay fund for victims, and mandates Apple to align PERM recruitment with its standard practices.

title: Warren Buffett-Led Berkshire Hathaway Sells Its Entire Procter & Gamble Stake. Should You?
summary: Berkshire Hathaway fully exited its small position in Procter & Gamble, likely due to consolidating its portfolio and P&G's premium valuation compared to other opportunities like Apple. Despite Berkshire's sale, P&G is still considered a worthwhile investment for risk-averse individuals due to its strong brand development, pricing power, and commitment to shareholder returns through dividends and buybacks. The article suggests that while P&G's valuation is high, its other characteristics make it a solid choice for passive income and portfolio stability.

title: Deere must face US farmers' 'right-to-repair' lawsuits, judge rules
summary: A U.S. judge has ruled that Deere & Co must face consolidated lawsuits from farmers accusing the agricultural machinery maker of unlawfully conspiring to restrict maintenance and repair services. The judge rejected Deere's arguments for dismissal, stating that the plaintiffs met the legal thresholds to pursue their antitrust claims. This case is part of a broader "right-to-repair" movement challenging restrictive repair practices across various industries.

title: Apple announces expanded partnership with Amkor for advanced silicon packaging in the U.S.
summary: Apple announced an expanded partnership with Amkor, designating Apple as the first and largest customer for Amkor's new manufacturing and packaging facility in Peoria, Arizona. This facility will package Apple silicon produced at the nearby TSMC fab, strengthening Apple's commitment to American manufacturing. Amkor plans to invest approximately $2 billion in the project, creating over 2,000 jobs, as part of Apple's broader commitment to invest $430 billion in the U.S. economy.

title: Who says corporate bonds are dull? Apple’s bonds have seen equity-like returns in the past month
summary: Apple Inc. bonds have generated equity-like returns for investors in the past month, with prices climbing as Treasury yields have tumbled. This rally, fueled by hopes for Federal Reserve rate cuts in 2024, has led to significant gains in the broader fixed-income market, with the Bloomberg US Aggregate Bond Index seeing its biggest monthly gain since May 1985.

title: One ETF that focuses on employee happiness is outperforming the market this year
summary: An ETF focused on companies with high employee happiness, the Harbor Human Capital Factor U.S. Large Cap ETF (HAPI), has outperformed the S&P 500 this year, climbing nearly 25% compared to the benchmark's less than 20% gain. The fund's strategy is based on Irrational Capital's extensive employee surveys and publicly available data, creating a "human capital score" that is considered a novel and uncorrelated investment factor. While the large-cap HAPI fund includes major tech stocks contributing to its performance, a similar small-cap ETF (HAPS) is also available, offering potential for future growth.

title: Amex CEO talks co-brand partnerships after Apple reports
summary: American Express CEO Steve Squeri discussed co-branded partnerships, emphasizing that Amex's "premium" card designation means it doesn't align with all potential partners, a point highlighted amidst reports of Amex potentially replacing Goldman Sachs as Apple's credit card partner. Squeri noted that Amex seeks partnerships that offer strong value propositions, target premium customers, and provide distribution while yielding "premium economics." Analysts have speculated on several potential suitors for Apple's card partnership, including Amex, JPMorgan Chase, Synchrony Financial, Capital One, and Bread.

title: Why Investors Should Keep An Eye on Small-Cap Stocks
summary: This article discusses how the increasing concentration of market-cap-weighted indexes, particularly driven by large-cap tech stocks, is creating historical levels of concentration. It explores the implications for the size premium, suggesting that higher market concentration leads to increased expected returns for small-cap stocks due to capital misallocation and reduced investor demand for smaller firms, making them an attractive area for investors.

title: Tesla’s Dojo Supercomputer Head Exits in Blow to Efforts
summary: Ganesh Venkataramanan, the head of Tesla's Dojo supercomputer project, has left the company after five years, posing a significant setback to the automaker's self-driving technology endeavors. Peter Bannon, a long-time Tesla director and former Apple executive, has taken over leadership of the project. This departure comes as Tesla plans to invest over $1 billion in Dojo by the end of 2024, a project analysts believe could add $500 billion to Tesla's valuation.

title: CastleArk Enters ETF Market With Large Growth ETF CARK
summary: CastleArk has launched its first exchange-traded fund, the CastleArk Large Growth ETF (CARK), an actively managed ETF focused on large-cap growth companies. The fund targets 25-30 leading growth companies, identifying competitive strength and seeking to optimize risk through quantitative inputs. CastleArk aims to provide an actively managed alternative to index-heavy portfolios, especially given the concentration of "Magnificent Seven" stocks in the large-cap growth sector.

title: Just 3 of the "Magnificent Seven" Have Outperformed the S&P 500 Since 2022. Here's the One I'd Buy for 2024 and 2025.
summary: This article analyzes the performance of the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks against the S&P 500 since 2022. It identifies Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple as the only three that have outperformed the S&P 500. The author argues that Alphabet, despite underperforming recently, is the best buy for 2024 and 2025 due to its valuation, potential in digital advertising, and cloud segment growth.

title: The Apple Inc (AAPL) DCF Valuation: Is The Stock Undervalued?
summary: This article presents a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) valuation for Apple Inc. (AAPL) to determine if the stock is undervalued. Based on the DCF analysis, Apple's stock appears overvalued with a DCF value of $118.68 per share compared to a current market price of $198.08, resulting in a negative margin of safety of -66.91%. The author emphasizes that this is a preliminary analysis and investors should conduct further research.

title: Qorvo to sell Chinese assembly, test factories to Luxshare ...
summary: Qorvo Inc. has agreed to sell its assembly and test facilities in Beijing and Dezhou, China, to Luxshare Precision Industry Co. Ltd. The deal includes Luxshare acquiring the facilities' assets, operations, and workforce, while Qorvo will continue to be supplied through a long-term agreement. This move allows Qorvo to streamline its manufacturing network while Luxshare expands its role in the electronics manufacturing services sector, particularly within the Apple supply chain.

title: T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF): A Promising Active Fund
summary: The T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF) has shown significant growth since its launch in June 2023, accumulating over $600 million in assets. The fund focuses on high-quality U.S. large-cap companies, employing a bottom-up stock selection approach with top holdings like Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon. TCAF's investment philosophy emphasizes strong performance in areas like technology, healthcare, and consumer discretionary.

title: Apple's stock underperformed top tech peers in 2023 due to longest revenue slide in 22 years
summary: Apple's stock underperformed its mega-cap tech peers in 2023, experiencing its longest revenue slide in 22 years with four consecutive quarters of declining sales. This decline was attributed to a combination of a weak economic environment for smartphones and PCs, and company-specific issues such as the lack of new iPad models and an Apple Watch sales ban. Despite a 49% stock rally for the year, Apple lagged behind competitors like Nvidia, Meta, Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft.

title: Cyber Hornet S&P 500 and Bitcoin 75/25 Strategy ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:ZZZ)
summary: The Cyber Hornet S&P 500 and Bitcoin 75/25 Strategy ETF (ZZZ) is an exchange-traded fund launched on December 28, 2023, by Onefund, which invests in a 75/25 blend of US large-cap stocks and front-month CME Bitcoin futures. It does not directly invest in Bitcoin's spot price. The ETF has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy," assets under management of $6.02 million, and a net expense ratio of 1.01%.

title: Markets in Focus: Concentrating on Diversification
summary: The article discusses the increasing concentration in equity markets, exemplified by the "Magnificent Seven" stocks, and the diminished diversification benefits of bonds, especially since 2020. It suggests that investors reassess top-down allocations and broaden equity exposure across diverse regions, sectors, and styles to create more resilient portfolios. The MSCI Adaptive Multi-Factor Allocation Model indicates an overweight to value and low size as of December 31, 2023, with Europe and China trading at lower historical valuations.

title: Best Socially Responsible Investment Apps of January 2024
summary: This article highlights the best socially responsible investment (SRI) apps for January 2024, detailing their features, pros, and cons. It explains what SRI is, differentiates it from ESG investing, and provides expert insights on the advantages and disadvantages of using these apps. The article reviews top platforms like IMPACT, Betterment, Sustainfolio, and Ellevest, among others, to help investors align their financial goals with their ethical values.

title: Software Glitch Behind Recalled App Could Drastically Increase Insulin Delivery
summary: A software glitch in a recalled app has the potential to drastically increase insulin delivery, posing a significant health risk. This issue was highlighted on January 10, 2024, by Brian Bossetta.

title: SKYX’s All-in-One Smart Platform is Everything from a Smart Speaker to a Smoke Detector
summary: SKYX Platforms Corp. debuted its patented All-in-One Smart Platform at CES 2024, aiming to make existing homes technologically advanced. This platform integrates multiple smart home features like a smoke/CO detector, smart speaker, Wi-Fi repeater, and various lighting controls, all controllable via app and voice commands. The product installs easily into a ceiling and supports major smart home ecosystems, with SKYX also renewing a global licensing agreement with GE.

title: Upcoming Events
summary: REX Shares, in collaboration with Tuttle Capital Management, has expanded its T-REX Single-Stock ETF suite with new offerings providing 200% daily targeted exposure to Apple, Alphabet, and Microsoft. These ETFs (AAPX, GOOX, MSFX) are designed for seasoned traders to give leveraged exposure to major tech stocks. The T-REX suite, which debuted in October 2023, now covers diverse tech sectors and has already attracted over $100 million in assets.

title: REX Shares and Tuttle Capital Management Expand T-REX Single-Stock ETF Suite with Apple, Alphabet, and Microsoft Offerings
summary: REX Shares and Tuttle Capital Management have expanded their T-REX Single-Stock ETF suite by introducing new offerings for Apple (CBOE: AAPX), Alphabet (CBOE: GOOX), and Microsoft (CBOE: MSFX). These ETFs provide seasoned traders with 200% daily targeted exposure to these major tech companies. The expansion aims to offer advanced tools for precise positioning in the tech giants, building on the success of earlier NVIDIA and Tesla single-stock ETFs which have attracted over $100 million in assets since their October 2023 launch.

title: Optimizing Communication and Data Sharing in Multi-Core SoC Designs
summary: This article discusses the evolution of interconnects in Systems-on-Chip (SoCs), from shared buses to Network-on-Chip (NoC) architectures, highlighting their role in managing data flow and enhancing performance. It delves into the importance of cache coherence for data consistency in multi-core designs and the challenges engineers face in optimizing communication and data sharing as semiconductor technology advances. The article also mentions Arteris' Ncore Cache Coherent Interconnect as a solution.

title: Jabil announces collaboration with Fintech Leader Revolut
summary: Jabil Inc. announced its ongoing collaboration with Revolut, a digital banking pioneer, to support the neobank's growth and global expansion in merchant acquiring. Jabil provides custom, pre-certified Point-of-Sale (POS) hardware platforms, including the Revolut Reader, which enables merchants to accept various in-store and on-the-go payments. The partnership highlights Jabil's role in accelerating market entry and providing comprehensive product design, development, and manufacturing solutions for Revolut's innovative payment solutions.

title: Unlocking The Potential Of Pure Research At InterDigital
summary: This article examines InterDigital's role as a pure research facility, led by CEO Liren Chen, and its significant contributions to wireless technology, including current work on 5G advanced and future plans for 6G with AI integration. It highlights InterDigital's impressive growth, long-standing partnerships with companies like Apple and Amazon, and its unique approach to fostering innovation among its largely inventor-based workforce. Chen emphasizes the importance of curiosity, competency, and impact in driving both individual and company success, showcasing InterDigital's continued influence on global digital communication.

title: Your S&P 500 Index Fund Has Higher Risk Than You May Think
summary: This article argues that the S&P 500 index fund, traditionally seen as diversified, now carries higher risk due to its concentration in a few technology stocks. It highlights concentration, valuation, and inflation risks, suggesting investors re-evaluate their S&P 500 holdings and consider more value-oriented, truly diversified investments.

title: Higher S&P 500 Earnings Could Benefit This Active ETF
summary: The NEOS S&P 500 High Income ETF (SPYI) is poised to benefit from expected higher corporate earnings in 2024, as forecasted by Goldman Sachs. SPYI, an actively managed ETF, focuses on call options and holds "Magnificent Seven" stocks, offering investors tailor-made holdings, risk mitigation, and tax-efficient monthly income. Its active management removes the need for constant supervision and provides a single solution for a core equity portfolio.

title: Corning's Indian JV signs $120 mln investment deal with Tamil Nadu state
summary: Corning's Indian joint venture, Bharat Innovative Glass Technologies, has signed an agreement with the Tamil Nadu state to invest 10 billion rupees ($120.4 million) to establish a new facility. This plant will manufacture front cover glass for mobile phones and phone parts, highlighting India's growing importance as a manufacturing hub amid a global shift in supply chains away from China. The investment is part of larger efforts by the Indian government to promote local manufacturing and has attracted other major electronics manufacturers and Apple suppliers.

title: Behind Target’s ‘Winning Retail Formula’
summary: Target Corp. actively expanded and renovated its stores in 2023, opening 21 new locations and remodeling over 160. The company's strategy focuses on a superior shopping experience through large-format stores, expanded assortments, enhanced fulfillment services, and strategic partnerships. Target plans further investments and new locations in 2024, continuing its growth trajectory in the retail sector.

title: Apple device management software company Jamf plans to layoff 6% of employees
summary: Jamf, an Apple device management software company, announced a workforce reduction plan to lay off approximately 6% of its full-time employees. This move is intended to reduce operating costs, improve operating margins, and achieve profitable growth. The company expects to incur between $6.6 and $8.2 million in charges for severance and related expenses, primarily in the first quarter of 2024.

title: What Gentex’s Acquisition Of eSight Means For The Electronic Eyewear Market
summary: Gentex Corporation has acquired Toronto-based eSight, a move that could significantly impact the electronic eyewear market for the visually impaired. This acquisition follows a partnership that led to the eSight Go, a new electronic eyewear system that is more affordable, lighter, and offers improved performance compared to its predecessor. Gentex's expertise in electro-optical products and manufacturing capabilities is expected to drive down costs and enhance the technology for sight enhancement wearables.

title: Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) Seeks FDA Nod for Next-Gen da Vinci 5
summary: Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) has applied for FDA 510(k) clearance for its next-generation da Vinci 5 multiport surgical robot and expects approval and launch later this year. The company is actively preparing manufacturing facilities for the new system while also engaging regulators in Japan and South Korea for approval. This development comes as the company's shares lost value a year ago due to the absence of a new multiport system announcement.

title: Corning beats quarterly sales estimates, signals improving demand for fiber optics
summary: Corning exceeded Wall Street's fourth-quarter adjusted sales estimates, driven by increasing demand for optical fiber cables used in data centers for generative AI applications. Despite a slight dip in optical communications segment sales, the company observes "green shoots" in the hyperscale data center space. Although Q4 earnings met expectations, Corning provided a conservative profit outlook for the current quarter, expecting it to be the low point of the year.

title: Payments firm PayPal to reduce global workforce by 9% in 2024
summary: Payments firm PayPal Holdings is set to cut approximately 2,500 jobs, or 9% of its global workforce, in 2024 through layoffs and the elimination of open roles. This decision, announced by CEO Alex Chriss, aims to "right-size" the company for efficiency and profitable growth amidst competitive pressures and a need to improve margins. The move follows similar cost-cutting measures by competitor Block.

title: Aptiv to cut stake in Motional, self-driving JV with Hyundai
summary: Aptiv, a US autonomous driving technology company, has decided to significantly reduce its stake in Motional, a self-driving joint venture with Hyundai Motor Group, and will cease injecting additional capital. Motional, which has accumulated 1 trillion won ($750 million) in deficits, had requested further funding from both partners. This decision puts pressure on Hyundai Motor Group to decide on its own additional capital injection, highlighting the ongoing financial and commercial challenges in the autonomous vehicle industry.

title: Disney Heads into the Future on the Apple Vision Pro
summary: The Walt Disney Company is launching Disney+ on Apple's Vision Pro, marking a new chapter in immersive storytelling. This integration allows viewers to experience Disney+ content in virtual environments like Star Wars' Tatooine or Marvel's Avengers Tower, and watch 3D versions of popular films. The partnership highlights Disney's long-standing focus on blending technology with creativity to enhance entertainment experiences.

title: Apple, Skechers fall; Amazon, Deckers Outdoor rise, Friday, 2/2/2024
summary: On Friday, February 2, 2024, several major stocks experienced significant price changes. Apple and Skechers saw declines due to lukewarm forecasts, while Amazon, Deckers Outdoor, Meta Platforms, and Clorox rose following strong financial results or optimistic outlooks. Microchip Technology and Columbia Sportswear also faced drops after giving disappointing forecasts.

title: These ETFs could help investors reduce Big Tech exposure
summary: Investors who are overly concentrated in Big Tech stocks are looking for ways to diversify their portfolios. Equal-weight ETFs like the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF and the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Technology ETF are suggested as options to spread risk beyond top-heavy Magnificent Seven companies, as advisors note nervousness about Big Tech valuations.

title: ESPN, Fox, and Warner Bros. Discovery Team Up to Offer Joint Sports Streaming Service
summary: Walt Disney's ESPN, Fox, and Warner Bros. Discovery are collaborating to launch a joint sports streaming service for U.S. customers available in the fall. This new service aims to combine their sports offerings, including professional and college games, to better compete with rivals like Comcast and Apple who have seen success in sports streaming. The app will be available standalone or bundled with Disney+, Hulu, or Max, consolidating vast sports rights under one platform.

title: ITOT ETF: Investing Well Doesn’t Have to Be Complicated
summary: The iShares Core S&P Total U.S. Stock Market ETF (ITOT) offers a straightforward, low-cost way to invest in a broad range of U.S. companies, providing exposure to 90% of the total domestic stock market. With an ultra-low expense ratio of 0.03% and a track record of strong double-digit annualized returns over the past decade, ITOT is presented as an effective long-term portfolio building block due to its wide diversification across 2,589 stocks. Despite its simplicity, it has delivered significant wealth building for investors since its inception in 2004.

title: ITOT ETF: Investing Well Doesn’t Have to Be Complicated
summary: The iShares Core S&P Total U.S. Stock Market ETF (ITOT) is presented as an effective, uncomplicated, and low-cost investment option for long-term growth. The article highlights ITOT's strong historical performance with double-digit annualized returns, wide diversification across 2,589 U.S. stocks, and an ultra-low expense ratio of 0.03%. It emphasizes the fund's lack of concentration risk due to its extensive holdings and its ability to provide exposure beyond just large-cap stocks.

title: Meta settles lawsuit over haptic feedback tech in Quest headsets
summary: Immersion, a company specializing in haptic feedback technology, has settled a lawsuit with Meta over Meta's use of touch-feedback in its Quest VR headsets. The settlement involves Meta licensing Immersion's patents for its hardware, software, VR, and gaming products, though the terms were not disclosed. Immersion has a history of pursuing patent infringement lawsuits against major tech companies like Microsoft, Sony, Apple, and Valve.

title: Relx Share Price Spiked Up 3% but Later Fell on FY 2023 Results
summary: Relx PLC announced strong FY 2023 financial results, reporting an 8% organic revenue growth to £9,161 million and a 13% organic adjusted operating profit increase to £3,030 million. The company proposed an 8% higher full-year dividend of 58.8p per share. Despite an initial 3% spike in its share price, it later fell, trading at 3430.5p.

title: Stryker updates Mako surgical robot, introduces joint replacement offering
summary: Stryker announced new advancements for its Mako surgical robotic platform, including the myMako app for Apple Vision Pro and iPhone and the Direct Anterior Reconstructive Technology (DART). The company also introduced Triathlon Hinge, a new offering in its Triathlon brand, designed to simplify revision procedures for complex cases involving bone loss or soft-tissue challenges. These updates were showcased at AAOS in San Francisco, with further Mako expansions, including Mako Spine and Mako Shoulder, anticipated later in 2024.

title: The Companies We’re Watching During Proxy-Voting Season 2024
summary: The 2024 proxy-voting season is marked by increased shareholder activism, particularly focusing on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues like climate impacts, workers' rights, and AI oversight. Key companies like Tesla, Apple, and Applied Materials are under scrutiny for their board governance, compensation, and ethical AI guidelines, amid growing regulatory momentum for climate disclosures. The season also highlights new opportunities for individual investors and increased scrutiny of "anti-ESG" resolutions.

title: Dimensional ETFs and More: New on Syfe Custom Portfolio
summary: Syfe Custom Portfolio is expanding its offerings with new equity ETFs from Dimensional Fund Advisors, focusing on value and quality tilts, alongside additional quality-focused and equally-weighted Nasdaq ETFs. The article details Dimensional's factor-based investing approach and highlights specific ETFs added to the platform, including options for accredited investors such as Bitcoin ETFs and a Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF. Syfe also explains how to utilize Custom Portfolios to complement existing investments by allowing tactical allocation based on asset class, risk, geography, and sector.

title: Episode #522: Wes Gray & Robert Elwood on How to Convert a Separately Managed Account (SMA) to an ETF
summary: This podcast episode features Wes Gray and Robert Elwood discussing their experience in converting Separately Managed Accounts (SMAs) to Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) via Section 351, including a recent conversion of $770 million. They delve into the process, advantages, and challenges of such conversions, highlighting tax efficiencies and the broader implications for financial advisors and family offices. The discussion also touches upon the future of asset management and the rising trend of SMA to ETF conversions.

title: How Nvidia grew to a trillion-dollar company fueling the AI revolution
summary: Nvidia has grown into a nearly $3 trillion company by specializing in Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), which have become crucial for the artificial intelligence revolution. Initially used for gaming, GPUs' ability to perform concurrent calculations makes them ideal for AI, giving Nvidia a significant first-mover advantage and market dominance. The company's unique technology and supply chain have led to widespread adoption by major tech firms, with discussions emerging about potential shortages and the need for continued investment in chip manufacturing.

title: A Wonderful Options-Based Dividend-Focused ETF?
summary: This article discusses the new Swan Global Enhanced Dividend Income Strategy (SCLZ) ETF, which combines Swan Global's options expertise with O'Shares Investment's stock selection. The ETF aims to provide sustainable retirement income through active management of options on dividend-growing companies, focusing on profitability and quality stocks. Key takeaways from a recent webcast highlighted the importance of active management, a profitability-based stock index, and a preference for "boring companies" that consistently generate dividends.

title: NANC ETF Tracking Democrat Stock Trades Beating S&P 500 on Tech Bets
summary: The Unusual Whales Democratic ETF (NANC), which tracks stock trades by Democrats in Congress, has outperformed the S&P 500 since its launch in February 2023, returning 30% compared to the S&P 500's 24%. This outperformance is largely attributed to its significant holdings in mega-cap tech stocks like Microsoft, Amazon, Apple, and Nvidia. In contrast, a similar ETF tracking Republican trades (KRUZ) has only gained about 15% over the same period.

title: VONG ETF: A Great Way to Invest in Top Growth Stocks
summary: The Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) offers a straightforward and effective way to invest in a diverse range of top growth stocks. With a strong track record of impressive returns, a low expense ratio of 0.08%, and a portfolio that includes leading mega-cap technology companies and other high-growth firms, VONG is considered a compelling option for investors seeking exposure to large-cap growth in the U.S. market. The ETF's holdings are highly rated, with many featuring Outperform-equivalent Smart Scores.

title: Nvidia skyrocketed over the past 5 years, but 3 stocks performed even better—and none is Apple or Tesla
summary: While Nvidia has achieved an impressive 1,904% return over the past five years, three mid-cap stocks have significantly outpaced it: e.l.f. Beauty (2,491%), Super Micro Computer (4,175%), and Celsius Holdings (over 5,300%). The article highlights that smaller companies (mid-caps) often show greater growth potential and less media coverage than large-cap stocks like Nvidia, suggesting diversification into these smaller companies can boost long-term returns. Investors are advised to use diversified funds (ETFs and mutual funds) to mitigate volatility and risk associated with individual small-cap stock picks.

title: Butterfly iQ+ Ultrasound System
summary: Butterfly iQ+ is a second-generation handheld, single-probe ultrasound system developed by Butterfly Network, utilizing Ultrasound-on-Chip™ semiconductor technology for diagnostic imaging. It has received regulatory approvals in the US and Canada and offers enhanced features for various medical applications, with subsequent generations (iQ3) further improving performance and imaging capabilities. Partnerships with Sientra and Abdul Latif Jameel Health aim to expand its distribution and application.

title: Dow's nearly 125-point rally led by gains for shares of NVIDIA Corp., Cisco
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose by nearly 125 points, primarily driven by strong performances from NVIDIA Corp. and Cisco Systems Inc. NVIDIA's shares surged after an analyst upgrade, while Cisco remained relatively flat despite an analyst reiteration of an overweight rating. The overall market saw NVIDIA and Cisco among the top gainers, contrasting with losses from other Dow components.

title: Magnificent Seven vs. the ‘Granolas’: How does Europe’s version stack up?
summary: This article compares the U.S. "Magnificent Seven" stocks with Europe's "Granolas," highlighting their differences in market value, sector diversity, and profitability. While the Magnificent Seven are largely tech-driven and exceptionally profitable, the Granolas offer broader sector representation and solid returns, often trading at a discount despite their strong performance. The piece examines historical returns, valuation ratios, and individual stock assessments for both groups.

title: ‘Funflation’ & Technology Driving Music Industry Resurgence
summary: The music industry is experiencing a resurgence fueled by "funflation" (increased spending on live events) and technological advancements such as streaming, AI, and blockchain. Record-breaking attendance at concerts, rising streaming subscriptions, and innovation are driving growth for companies like Live Nation, Universal Music, and Warner Music Group. The MUSQ ETF offers a pure-play investment into this evolving and increasingly monetized global music market.

title: HP Inc. CEO: Security Will Be A ‘Key Advantage’ In Our AI PC Strategy
summary: HP CEO Enrique Lores announced that security will be a "key advantage" in the company's AI PC strategy, emphasizing local large language model processing for enhanced security, lower costs, and faster performance compared to cloud solutions. HP plans to leverage its Wolf Security technologies to protect AI models running on these new PCs, which are expected to launch in the second half of 2024. Lores believes AI PCs represent a significant opportunity for channel partners due to device sales and the coming wave of AI-optimized software.

title: How to Invest in Technology
summary: This article provides an overview of how to invest in the technology sector, highlighting its rapid evolution and significant growth over the past two decades. It breaks down key tech market developments, discusses sectors with high potential like AI, mobile gaming, 3D printing, and blockchain, and offers various investment methods including ETFs and individual stocks.

title: SCHX: As Cheap As It Gets For Large-Cap Exposure
summary: This article recommends the Schwab U.S. Large-Cap ETF (SCHX) for investors seeking exposure to large-cap stocks, highlighting its diversification, low costs, and tax efficiency. Key holdings include tech giants like Microsoft and Apple, leading to significant exposure to the Information Technology sector. The author, Michael A. Gayed, CFA, discusses market efficiency and offers insights from his Lead-Lag Report service.

title: Alphabet is the bargain stock among the ‘Magnificent Seven’
summary: Alphabet, Google's holding company, is highlighted as a compelling investment opportunity among the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks due to its valuation. Its stock trades at a lower price/earnings valuation than the S&P 500, positioning it as a bargain compared to its peers and the broader market. This situation is likened to the opportunity presented by Meta's stock after its 2022 decline.

title: Apple v. Rivos: Lessons for Companies Facing Claims of Trade Secret Theft (US)
summary: This article discusses the lessons learned from the Apple v. Rivos case regarding trade secret theft. It highlights that mere possession of trade secrets is insufficient for misappropriation claims against a new employer and emphasizes the importance of explicit policies against bringing confidential information from former employers. The ruling provides key takeaways for companies to guide their trade secret policies and practices to avoid litigation.

title: Will Warren Buffett Keep Selling Apple?
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway recently reduced its stake in Apple, leading to speculation about whether further sales will occur. This article explores Buffett's history with Apple, current challenges facing the tech giant such as declining sales in China and competitive pressures, and the potential market reaction to Berkshire's next 13F filing. Analysts offer differing views on Apple's future, particularly with the upcoming integration of AI.

title: LaCie Introduces New Rugged Mini SSD with Up to 4TB Capacity
summary: LaCie, a brand of Seagate, has introduced the new Rugged Mini SSD, offering up to 4TB of durable, fast, and compact storage for content creators. This portable drive boasts read speeds of up to 2000MB/s with USB 3.2 gen 2x2 technology and features an IP54-rated, 3-meter drop-protected, and 1-ton car pressure-resistant design using recycled materials. It is compatible with a wide range of devices including Apple products and PCs, and comes with a three-year warranty, data recovery services, and a one-month Adobe Creative Cloud All Apps plan.

title: VGT ETF: High Growth, High Concentration (NYSEARCA:VGT)
summary: Vanguard's Information Technology ETF (VGT) has demonstrated strong historical returns, achieving a 48.3% return over the past year and an average annual return of 20% over the last decade. However, the fund is highly concentrated, with Microsoft and Apple accounting for nearly 41% of its investments. VGT offers a low dividend yield of 0.6%, making it less appealing for investors prioritizing income.

title: Apple Highlights Stryker, an NJIT Alum's Medical Tech Group, for VisionPro App
summary: Apple has recognized Stryker Corp., a medical technology company led by NJIT alumnus Robert Cohen, for its innovative MyMako app utilizing the new VisionPro mixed-reality headset. This app allows surgeons to plan and simulate robot-assisted knee replacement operations in 3D, enhancing surgical planning, in-operation information access, and resident training. Cohen envisions future integration of AI to further optimize implant selection and placement based on patient data within this mixed-reality framework.

title: Gaia Launches Gaia+, the World’s Most Extensive Streaming Platform for Transformation
summary: Gaia, Inc. has launched Gaia+, an enhanced streaming platform offering over 8,000 documentaries and series focused on transformation, spiritual growth, and consciousness expansion. This new platform provides access to immersive workshops, live events, and guided programs led by expert teachers. Gaia+ aims to empower its community with resources for personal development, stress alleviation, and abundance manifestation, available across various mobile and connected TV devices.

title: Options Bulls Resume Blitz on Alphabet Stock
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) stock is seeing renewed bullish options activity, with shares up 6.1% following reports of Apple potentially licensing Google's Gemini AI. Despite a recent uptick in bearish bets, call volume is again dominating today's options trading as GOOGL eyes its Jan. 29 record high.

title: Meta Bows Down to EU Regulations After Apple And Google, Cut Subscription Prices for Ad-Free Facebook and Instagram
summary: Meta Platforms has significantly reduced the subscription fee for its ad-free Facebook and Instagram services in Europe, lowering the monthly cost to 5.99 euros from 9.99 euros. This move addresses concerns from privacy and antitrust regulators and comes as a response to the EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA). The company aims to find a middle ground amidst EU privacy laws and the DMA's stipulations, following similar concessions by Google and Apple.

title: Meta, Microsoft, X and Match join Epic Games' battle against Apple
summary: Meta Platforms, Microsoft, X, and Match Group have joined Epic Games in accusing Apple of violating a court-ordered injunction regarding payments in its App Store. The companies claim Apple is in "clear violation" by making it difficult for developers to direct consumers to alternative, cheaper payment methods for digital content. Apple, however, maintains it has fully complied with the injunction, arguing it protects consumers and its ecosystem.

title: Impact Shares YWCA Women’s Empowerment ETF (WOMN) Reaches $50M in Assets Under Management
summary: The Impact Shares YWCA Women’s Empowerment ETF ($WOMN) has surpassed $50 million in Assets Under Management (AUM), demonstrating investor interest in socially conscious funds. This ETF provides broad market exposure to U.S. companies promoting gender equity, with all net advisory profits donated to the YWCA to support its mission. The partnership between Impact Shares, Tidal Financial Group, and the YWCA highlights an innovative approach to aligning financial returns with social impact.

title: The U.S. sues Apple, saying it abuses its power to monopolize the smartphone market
summary: The Justice Department, along with 15 states and D.C., has filed a major antitrust lawsuit against Apple, accusing the tech giant of abusing its monopoly power in the smartphone market. The lawsuit alleges that Apple restricts access to its hardware and software, designs features like iMessage and Apple Pay to lock users into its ecosystem, and suppresses competition, leading to fewer options and higher prices for consumers. Apple denies these claims, stating that its restrictions protect user privacy and security, and vows to vigorously defend itself against the suit.

title: DOJ faces tough road in Apple antitrust lawsuit
summary: The Department of Justice's antitrust lawsuit against Apple faces significant challenges, despite drawing parallels to the successful Microsoft case two decades ago. Antitrust specialists highlight key differences and legal precedents that could make it difficult for the DOJ to prove Apple's monopolistic conduct and force product redesigns. Apple is expected to argue that its "walled-garden" approach benefits consumers and that the government's market definition is flawed.

title: Masimo plans to spin off consumer business
summary: Medical technology company Masimo Corp is evaluating a proposed spinoff of its consumer business, which includes consumer health and audio products. Masimo's shares rose 13% on the news, which follows investor pressure for changes after a poorly received acquisition. The company plans to retain its healthcare and telehealth products, expecting improved profitability, and current CEO Joe Kiani will lead the new spun-off company as chairman.

title: Wait, Did Europe Really Outperform the U.S. over the Last Three Years?
summary: This article challenges the common perception that European equities perpetually lag behind their U.S. counterparts. It highlights how a selection of 11 European "GRANOLAS" companies have delivered returns surprisingly similar to the U.S. Magnificent 7 over the past three years. Additionally, the WisdomTree Europe Hedged Equity Fund (HEDJ) has demonstrated significant outperformance against the S&P 500 and comparable European ETFs, attributed to its stock selection process, dividend yield weighting, and exporter tilt, all while trading at a valuation discount.

title: RERE: INITIATION: Leading Recycling Platform in China’s Burgeoning Circular Economy
summary: Zacks Small Cap Research initiated coverage on ATRenew Inc. (NYSE: RERE) with a 12-month price target of $4.00, citing its leadership in China's pre-owned consumer electronics market. The investment thesis highlights ATRenew's differentiated business model, multi-pronged growth strategy, accelerating financial performance, strong capital base, and attractive valuation. The report provides a deep dive into the company's operations, growth drivers, financial model, and investment risks.

title: A new product allows 5x leveraged bets on the Magnificent Seven. Traders should be wary.
summary: A new exchange-traded product allows investors to make 5x leveraged bets on the Magnificent Seven group of stocks, raising concerns among analysts. While levered exchange-traded products are gaining popularity, traders are warned about the significant risks associated with such highly leveraged instruments. ETF analyst Todd Sohn from Strategas Securities notes that this product appears to be the most heavily levered available in any developed market.

title: SEC sides with ADF attorneys, denies Wells Fargo, Charles Schwab attempts to dodge shareholders
summary: The SEC has sided with Alliance Defending Freedom attorneys in two recent decisions, denying attempts by Wells Fargo and Charles Schwab to exclude shareholder proposals from their proxy ballots. This marks ADF's fifth such victory, compelling financial giants to address concerns regarding politicized de-banking and workforce discrimination rooted in DEI policies. The rulings emphasize shareholder accountability and transparency in corporate decision-making.

title: F5 Networks (FFIV) Appoints Kunal Anand as Chief Technology Officer
summary: F5, Inc. announced the appointment of Kunal Anand as Executive Vice President and Chief Technology Officer (CTO), alongside Lyra Schramm as Executive Vice President and Chief People Officer (CPO). Anand will be responsible for F5's technology vision, leveraging his expertise in cybersecurity and data to accelerate the company's leadership in application and API security. Schramm will focus on driving people initiatives and fostering an innovative workplace culture.

title: Target shopper data, streaming TV ads are key to its sales
summary: Target is increasingly relying on its retail media unit, Roundel, which creates and sells ads using shopper data and streaming TV ads, to drive revenue and improve gross margins. Despite declining merchandise sales, Target's ad business grew over 20% in its last fiscal year, leveraging insights from 250 million annual store and website visits to target specific shoppers for brands like Enfamil and Apple. While the ad business provides significant value, some advertisers note that Roundel offers less control over campaigns compared to rivals like Amazon and Walmart.

title: If I Could Only Buy and Hold 1 Vanguard ETF For the Next 5 Years, This Would Be My Top Pick
summary: The article recommends the Vanguard Large-Cap ETF (VV) as a top choice for a buy-and-hold strategy for the next five years due to its low expense ratio, focus on U.S. large-cap stocks like Microsoft, Apple, and Nvidia, and its ability to provide broad diversification. It highlights the ETF's simplicity and stability, making it easier for investors to hold through market volatility compared to individual stocks or more specialized thematic ETFs. The author also notes the subtle differences and near-identical returns between VV and the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF, with a slight preference for VV.

title: Apple Signs Deal For AI Training Data from Image Service Shutterstock
summary: Apple has signed a deal worth between $25 million and $50 million with Shutterstock to access its vast archive of images, video, and music for training AI systems. This move indicates Apple's strategic intent to develop its own AI models, rather than relying solely on existing solutions. The deal highlights Apple's characteristic approach to adhere to rules and protect user privacy, contrasting with some competitors' controversial methods of data acquisition.

title: IHG Hotels & Resorts Launches Apple AirPlay in North American Hotels
summary: IHG Hotels & Resorts has become the first hospitality company to launch Apple AirPlay functionality in its North American hotel rooms, allowing guests to securely stream content from their iPhone or iPad to in-room LG TVs. This new feature is currently available at over 60 locations and aims to enhance the guest experience by offering personalized entertainment and a "home-away-from-home" environment. Guests can connect privately and securely by scanning a unique QR code to the hotel's Wi-Fi network.

title: Why Kartoon Studios (TOON) Shares Are Falling
summary: Kartoon Studios (NASDAQ: TOON) shares are down 26% after the company announced the pricing of a registered direct offering of up to 7 million shares of its common stock and/or pre-funded warrants to institutional investors. The offering is expected to generate approximately $7 million in gross proceeds. The first tranche of 4 million shares is set to close around April 22, with an option for investors to purchase an additional 3 million shares within 180 days.

title: Apple Inc (AAPL) DCF Valuation: Is The Stock Undervalued?
summary: This article presents a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) valuation for Apple Inc. (AAPL), concluding that the stock is overvalued. Based on the analysis, Apple's intrinsic value is estimated at $112.24 per share, significantly lower than its current market price of $167.20, resulting in a negative margin of safety. The DCF model uses specific inputs for discount rate, terminal growth rate, and WACC, along with forecasted free cash flows to arrive at the valuation.

title: Apple contributes to the environment by investing in water and clean energy
summary: Apple is a global leader in technology and a pioneer in ecology, committing to protecting the environment by investing in water and clean energy. The company aims to achieve climate neutrality across all business areas by 2030, actively optimizing its supply chain, investing in renewable energy, and engaging in water conservation efforts. These initiatives include developing solar and wind farms, restoring water supplies, and issuing green bonds to fund its environmental projects, influencing both consumers and business partners toward sustainable practices.

title: KKR joins global cos betting billions of dollars in fastest-growing India
summary: KKR & Co. is optimistic about investment opportunities in India's consumer sector and is expanding its private credit portfolio, planning to deploy $10 billion at a faster pace. The firm, along with others like Blackstone and Goldman Sachs, is attracted by India's rapid economic growth and government incentives for manufacturing. Despite past challenges, KKR remains committed to India, exploring new sectors like manufacturing and potentially real estate in the future.

title: How to Buy Alphabet (Google) Stock Online in 2025
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to buy Alphabet (Google) stock online in 2025, detailing steps, top brokers, and reasons to invest in the company. It covers Google's diverse services, its financial performance, business strategy, and historical stock information, emphasizing its growth and expansion into new technologies like AI. The article also addresses common FAQs regarding Alphabet stock.

title: Microsoft to invest $1.7 billion in cloud, AI in Indonesia, CEO says
summary: Microsoft announced a $1.7 billion investment over the next four years to expand cloud services and artificial intelligence in Indonesia, including building data centers. CEO Satya Nadella is on a Southeast Asian tour to promote the company's generative AI technology. Microsoft also plans to train 2.5 million people in Southeast Asia in AI use by 2025, with 840,000 specifically in Indonesia.

title: The DOJ’s Apple antitrust suit doesn’t add up
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice has filed an antitrust suit against Apple, accusing it of anticompetitive conduct relating to its iOS operating system. The article argues that the DOJ's claims, which center on product tying and vertical restraints, fundamentally misunderstand Apple's long-standing "walled garden" approach, which many consumers prefer for its security and user experience. It also suggests that the alleged anticompetitive acts in areas like digital wallets or the App Store are not lucrative enough to justify the severe remedies sought by the DOJ, unlike the Microsoft case often referenced.

title: 2 Great Large-Cap ETFs
summary: This article recommends two large-cap ETFs, T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF) and Vanguard High Dividend Yield ETF (VYM), as excellent portfolio building blocks. Russel Kinnel explains his rationale for owning both, highlighting TCAF's skilled manager David Giroux and VYM's value tilt for diversification.

title: Can Crowding Scores Quantify US Stocks’ Fragility?
summary: The U.S. equity market has reached an unprecedented level of concentration, largely driven by mega-cap tech stocks, sparking concerns about market fragility and crowding risk. While crowded stocks globally have historically underperformed uncrowded ones, the U.S. market has recently bucked this trend, with crowded stocks outperforming since mid-2022. The MSCI Security Crowding Model offers insights into identifying areas of the market most susceptible to price correction if sentiment deteriorates.

title: Digital Map Market Size, Share with Focus on Emerging Technologies, Top Countries Data, Top Key Players Update, and Forecast 2029
summary: The digital map market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 11.1% from USD 28.3 billion in 2024 to USD 47.8 billion by 2029, driven by increased organizational need for efficiency and scalability. The routing and navigation data segment is expected to hold the largest market share, with the Asia Pacific region experiencing the highest growth rates due to technological advancements and smartphone adoption. Key players like Google, Apple, and Nearmap are adopting various growth strategies to expand their market presence.

title: Faulty insulin pump tech led to hundreds of injuries, prompting app recall
summary: A software glitch in an insulin pump app developed by Tandem Diabetes Care led to over 200 injuries due to unexpected pump shutdowns. The FDA has prompted the recall of more than 85,000 versions of the t:connect mobile app, which could drain the pump's battery and suspend insulin delivery, potentially causing serious health complications. Users are urged to update the app to version 2.7.1 or later immediately.

title: PNQI: I'm Buying This Tech Stock ETF Instead Of QQQ (NASDAQ:PNQI)
summary: The Invesco NASDAQ Internet ETF (PNQI) is a tech-focused ETF with $751 million in assets and a diversified portfolio of about 80 positions. It has been in an uptrend since late last year and holds significant stakes in Alphabet, Amazon, and Apple. The author, a long-time stock market investor, is buying PNQI, expressing their own opinions and having a beneficial long position in its shares.

title: Apple’s Planning a $110B Stock Buyback. Here's Why. | Poole Thought Leadership
summary: Apple Inc. announced a significant $110 billion stock buyback plan, prompting Poole College finance professor Richard Warr to explain the rationale behind such corporate actions.
