title: Apple Earnings: Our Valuation Rises to Reflect Stronger Long-Term Growth, but Less of an AI Impact
summary: Morningstar has raised its fair value estimate for Apple to $200 from $185, driven by stronger longer-term growth expectations, particularly from iPhone unit sales and the services segment, along with expected margin expansion. However, the short-term forecast for iPhone revenue has been lowered due to a perceived lesser impact from AI on unit sales in the immediate future, leading to the conclusion that shares are currently overvalued. The article notes a positive inflection in iPhone revenue in the September quarter and continued strong growth in services.

title: Apple accused by NLRB of deterring employees from discussing pay equity
summary: The National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) has filed a complaint accusing Apple of preventing employees from discussing pay equity and forcing an engineer to quit after she circulated a wage survey. This marks the third such complaint in a month against Apple, which is also alleged to have barred a Slack channel for pay equity discussions and restricted employees' use of social media and workplace messaging. Apple denies the claims, stating that it strongly disagrees and will share the facts at the hearing.

title: CoreCard Corporation (NYSE:CCRD) Q3 2024 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: CoreCard Corporation (NYSE:CCRD) reported better-than-expected Q3 2024 results, with total revenue up 17% year-over-year to $15.7 million, driven by higher license, professional services, and processing/maintenance revenues. The company provided 2025 guidance forecasting total revenue between $60 million and $64 million, and earnings per share between $0.88 and $0.94, with revenue growth excluding Goldman Sachs anticipated at 30% to 40%. CEO Leland Strange also discussed the secured Goldman Sachs agreement through 2026, the ongoing development of their CoreFi platform, and the company's share repurchase program, reiterating that the stock is undervalued.

title: Nvidia surpasses Apple to become world’s most valuable company
summary: Nvidia has overtaken Apple to become the world's most valuable company, with its market capitalization reaching $3.43 trillion. This shift highlights the increasing dominance of artificial intelligence in the technology sector, as Nvidia's shares have nearly tripled in 2024. The AI darling's stock closed at $139.91 on Tuesday.

title: Nvidia passes Apple as world's most valuable company
summary: Nvidia has once again surpassed Apple to become the world's most valuable publicly traded company, reaching a market cap of $3.43 trillion. This comes as Nvidia's stock has nearly tripled in 2024 due to high demand for its GPUs in the AI market, while Apple's shares are up about 17% this year. Nvidia is also set to join the Dow Industrial Average, replacing Intel.

title: SolarEdge Announces Changes to the Board of Directors
summary: SolarEdge Technologies, Inc. announced changes to its Board of Directors, electing Avery More as Chairman and appointing Guy Gecht as a new member. Gecht, bringing extensive experience from the technology and cybersecurity sectors, will replace Tal Payne, who stepped down. The company expressed confidence that these changes will strengthen the Board and guide future innovation and growth.

title: Analysts Say ‘We Would Be Aggressive Buyers on Any Pullbacks’ in Microsoft Stock. Should You Be Too?
summary: Despite a slight dip after its latest earnings report due to increased capital expenditures, Microsoft (MSFT) is viewed by analysts, including Morgan Stanley's Keith Weiss, as a strong buy on any pullbacks. The company exceeded Q1 earnings expectations across all segments, particularly in Intelligent Cloud (Azure), and analysts project continued strong growth for its stock. With 41 out of 48 analysts recommending a "Strong Buy" and an average price target implying a 27% upside, the sentiment suggests that Microsoft's AI advancements and robust financial performance make it an attractive investment despite market fluctuations.

title: Is Apple Inc. (AAPL) a Good Stock to Buy Now According to Redditors?
summary: This article examines Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) as a stock to buy according to Redditors, ranking it 5th on a list of top trending stocks. It discusses recent market trends, the impact of AI on mega-cap stocks, and strategies for hedging risks. The article highlights Apple's strong fundamentals, cash reserves, and growth potential, particularly with its new Apple Intelligence platform, citing positive analyst sentiments and a record-breaking September quarter.

title: World's Largest Technology Company by Revenue, world record set by Apple Inc.
summary: Apple Inc. has set a world record for being the World's Largest Technology Company by Revenue, with US$383.29 billion in revenues in 2023. The company, founded in 1976, is headquartered in Cupertino, California, and is known for its consumer electronics, software, and services. Apple has also been recognized as the world's most valuable brand and the largest company by market capitalization.

title: Apple’s Next Device Is an AI Wall Tablet for Home Control, Siri and Video Calls
summary: Apple is preparing to launch a new wall-mounted AI tablet, code-named J490, designed to be a smart home command center. The device will control appliances, handle video calls, and leverage the new Apple Intelligence AI platform, positioning Apple to compete with rivals like Amazon and Google in the smart home market. A more advanced, robotic version with an AI personality is also in development, potentially priced up to $1,000.

title: Polen Capital Focus Growth Strategy Exited Salesforce (CRM) for Better Opportunities
summary: Polen Capital's Focus Growth Strategy exited its position in Salesforce (CRM) during the third quarter of 2024 to pursue better opportunities in companies like Shopify and MSCI. The decision was driven by Salesforce's slower-than-expected revenue growth in a weakening macroeconomic environment and the maturity of its core end markets. Salesforce, Inc. saw an 18.51% one-month return and a 54.50% gain over the last 52 weeks but contributed negatively to Polen Focus Growth Strategy's performance due to a slowdown in revenue and bookings growth.

title: Buffett's Berkshire Buys Shares of Domino's Pizza and Pool Corp., Dumps Apple Stock
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway acquired stakes in Domino's Pizza and Pool Corp. during the third quarter of 2024, while significantly reducing its holdings in Apple and Bank of America. Berkshire's cash pile surged to a record $320.3 billion, indicating a net selling position for the conglomerate as it awaits new investment opportunities. The company also slashed its stake in Ulta Beauty and added to Heico Corp.

title: Buffett’s Berkshire Buys Stakes in Domino’s Pizza, Pool Corp. (DPZ, BRK/A): 13F
summary: Berkshire Hathaway Inc. acquired stakes in Domino’s Pizza Inc. and Pool Corp. during the third quarter, while simultaneously trimming some long-held investments. The conglomerate, led by Warren Buffett, purchased approximately 1.3 million shares in Domino's, establishing a 3.6% stake valued at around $550 million. These new holdings were disclosed in a regulatory filing, and shares of both companies saw a jump in late New York trading.

title: Berkshire bites into Domino's Pizza, dips into Pool as stock retreat
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway announced new investments in Domino's Pizza and Pool Corp in the third quarter, while simultaneously reducing its holdings in stocks like Apple and Bank of America. The conglomerate also significantly increased its cash reserves to $325.2 billion and halted stock repurchases, suggesting a cautious outlook on current market valuations, while still preserving capacity for a major acquisition.

title: Berkshire bites into Domino's Pizza, dips into Pool amid stock retreat
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway disclosed new investments in Domino's Pizza and Pool Corp during the third quarter of 2024, despite significantly reducing its overall stock holdings, particularly in Apple and Bank of America. These purchases come as Berkshire nearly doubled its cash reserves to $325.2 billion and halted stock buybacks, suggesting a cautious stance amid high valuations. The new investments caused shares of Domino's and Pool to rise, reflecting investor confidence in Berkshire's selections.

title: Chilton Investment Co LLC Boosts Stake in Apple Inc
summary: Chilton Investment Co LLC, managed by Richard Chilton, has increased its stake in Apple Inc (AAPL) by 26,195 shares. Spark, TipRanks' AI Analyst, rates AAPL as "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance and robust revenue growth, despite high valuation and overbought technical indicators. Apple's strategic focus on services and overcoming supply chain issues are seen as positive long-term growth factors.

title: What’s up with… SK Telecom, T-Mobile US, the FCC
summary: SK Telecom has launched an AI Customer Service Support System underpinned by its proprietary Telco LLM and LMM, aiming to set new standards in customer service. T-Mobile US was reportedly among the telcos targeted by Chinese cybercriminals in an extensive espionage campaign. Meanwhile, Brendan Carr is set to become the next FCC chairman, poised to introduce significant policy changes, and the global telecom and pay-TV services sector is projected for healthy growth in 2024.

title: FBY: One Of My Favorite Santa's Income Plays
summary: The author sees an opportunity to invest in big tech, particularly META, after a recent market sell-off, citing strong leadership and innovation. FBY, a YieldMax ETF for META, is highlighted as a favorable pick for high dividends and potential capital gains, especially in anticipation of a "Santa rally." The article suggests FBY offers a safer income play through covered call strategies compared to direct stock ownership.

title: The Smartest Megacap Growth ETF to Buy With $500 Right Now
summary: This article recommends the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK) as a top investment for those seeking exposure to leading growth stocks, especially in technology and other high-potential industries, for as little as $500. The ETF has significantly outperformed the S&P 500 in both the short and long term, boasting a low expense ratio and diversified holdings including Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft. It highlights the benefits of ETFs for easy diversification and access to market-leading companies without requiring extensive individual stock research.

title: Corsair Unveils The First True Gaming Keyboard And Mouse For Macs
summary: Corsair has launched the first true gaming keyboard and mouse designed specifically for Macs, aiming to enhance the gaming experience on Apple devices. The K65 Plus Wireless keyboard and M75 Wireless gaming mouse come in Mac-exclusive colorways and are available through Apple. These peripherals, coupled with Apple's recent focus on gaming and the powerful M4 chip in the Mac mini, suggest a growing potential for Mac gaming.

title: VOOG vs. SCHG: Which Is the Better Growth Stock ETF?
summary: This article compares two popular growth ETFs, the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOOG) and the Schwab U.S. Large Cap Growth ETF (SCHG). While both are strong performers with similar portfolios of top growth stocks like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, SCHG consistently outperforms VOOG in 3, 5, and 10-year returns and boasts a significantly lower expense ratio. The analysis concludes that SCHG is the better choice due to its superior performance and lower costs.

title: America eats the world
summary: This article discusses the unprecedented dominance of US equities in the world market, with the S&P 500 now accounting for two-thirds of the world equity index. It explores how this concentration has occurred, driven by the rise of technology and the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks, and questions whether this momentum is sustainable in the long term, especially considering the shift of these tech giants towards more capital-heavy AI investments. The author uses a "second-level thinking" approach to analyze the drivers and potential challenges to this US market leadership.

title: Under the Hood of Fidelity’s Blue Chip Growth
summary: The Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF (FBCG) is an active U.S. equity growth strategy with a large-cap bias that has outperformed its benchmark, the Russel 1000 Growth index. The fund focuses on identifying blue chip companies with sustainable business models, high returns on equity, and strong revenue and earnings growth through bottom-up fundamental analysis. FBCG's portfolio includes both mega-cap companies and smaller emerging growers, aiming for consistent +10% annual EPS growth.

title: ICLV: Value With Some Tech Exposure (NYSEARCA:ILCV)
summary: The iShares Morningstar Value ETF (ILCV) offers a diversified portfolio of 444 large- and mid-cap U.S. stocks with a low expense ratio of 0.04%. It balances traditional value sectors like Financials and Industrials with growth areas such as Information Technology and Health Care. This mix provides pure domestic market exposure and aims for a balanced risk-return profile, despite some concentration in the Financial sector.

title: Billionaire Warren Buffett Pours $752,000,000 Into New Assets After Dumping Apple, Bank of America
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has invested $752 million into new assets, Domino's (DPZ) and Pool Corp (POOL), while significantly reducing its holdings in Apple (AAPL) and Bank of America (BAC). The firm's 13F filing shows a continued commitment to consumer-focused businesses with competitive advantages. Despite the sales, Apple remains Berkshire's largest holding, followed by American Express and Bank of America.

title: Here's How Much You Would Need to Invest in This Unstoppable Vanguard ETF Today to Grow Your Portfolio to $1 Million or More by Retirement
summary: This article discusses using the Vanguard S&P 500 Growth Index Fund ETF Shares (VOOG) as a vehicle for long-term wealth accumulation, aiming for $1 million by retirement. It highlights the ETF's focus on growth stocks within the S&P 500, its low expense ratio, and historical outperformance. The author provides a table illustrating the investment amounts needed over 30 and 35 years, assuming an 8% annual growth rate, suggesting at least $70,000 for 35 years to reach the $1 million goal.

title: Corning offers to waive exclusive deals in EU antitrust probe, may stave off fine
summary: Corning has offered to drop all exclusive dealing clauses in its agreements with mobile phone makers and raw glass processing companies to resolve an EU antitrust investigation. This move could help the company avoid a significant fine. The European Commission will now open a six-week feedback period for third parties before deciding whether to accept Corning's concessions, which would last for nine years.

title: The S&P 500 is expected to return 10% in 2025
summary: Goldman Sachs Research anticipates the S&P 500 to return 10% in 2025, reaching 6,500 due to solid economic expansion and steady earnings growth. While valuations are high and political changes could introduce risks, Goldman Sachs advises investors to leverage low volatility periods. The report also highlights continued outperformance for "Magnificent 7" stocks, potential M&A increases, and a shift in AI investment focus towards application rollout and monetization.

title: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and Apple to Lead with TSM’s Advanced 2nm AI Chips in 2025
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and Apple are expected to be the first customers for TSMC's advanced 2nm AI chips, with mass production scheduled to begin in 2025. This development highlights the increasing importance of advanced semiconductor technology in the AI sector and positions AMD as a key player among trending AI stocks. The article also touches on significant investments in AI startups and the overall boom in the AI market.

title: 2 no-brainer Warren Buffett stocks to buy into 2025
summary: As 2024 concludes, investors are looking to Warren Buffett's philosophy for guidance. This article highlights two "forever stocks" from Buffett's portfolio, Pool Corporation (NASDAQ: POOL) and Coca-Cola (NYSE: KO), as compelling long-term opportunities for 2025. It examines their recent performance, financial stability, and potential for growth.

title: Should iShares S&P 500 Growth ETF (IVW) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares S&P 500 Growth ETF (IVW) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Growth segment of the US equity market, with significant holdings in Information Technology, and top positions in Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. With an expense ratio of 0.18% and a "Buy" rating from Zacks, it presents a compelling option for investors seeking growth, despite the inherent volatility of growth stocks. The fund has shown strong performance, up about 34.84% year-to-date and 40% over the last year.

title: Arista Networks announces a four-for-one stock split
summary: Arista Networks (NYSE: ANET) has announced a four-for-one stock split, effective December 3, 2024, by increasing its authorized common stock from 1 billion to 4 billion shares. This move aims to make the stock more accessible to a broader investor base and enhance liquidity without altering the company's fundamental value or market capitalization. The decision follows a strong financial performance, with 20% year-over-year revenue growth in Q3 and significant new product introductions.

title: Tech stocks hit first all-time high since July
summary: Technology stocks reached new all-time highs on Wednesday, driven by strong performances from key software players like Salesforce, Adobe, and ServiceNow, as well as megacap companies such as Apple, Nvidia, and Amazon. The Nasdaq Composite rallied 1%, and the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) advanced 1.8%, marking its first new high since July. Marvell Technology also saw significant gains, surging 23% after a strong quarter.

title: Contact - The Lethbridge Herald - News and Sports from around Lethbridge
summary: Simplify Asset Management Inc. announced that its Simplify Stable Income ETF (NYSE Arca: BUCK) has been renamed the Simplify Treasury Option Income ETF. This change became effective on October 29, 2024. Simplify Asset Management, founded in 2020, specializes in options-based strategies to address portfolio challenges.

title: The Inside Story of Apple Intelligence
summary: This article delves into Apple's strategy for generative AI, dubbed Apple Intelligence, highlighting the company's "best, not first" approach. Key executives, including John Giannandrea and Craig Federighi, explain that Apple has been preparing for this moment for years and focused on integrating AI at a systems level with a strong emphasis on privacy. The piece also contrasts Apple's approach with competitors and discusses the future trajectory of AI at Apple.

title: Apple plans three-year modem rollout to compete with Qualcomm, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Apple is preparing to launch its own series of cellular modem chips starting next year, aiming to replace components from Qualcomm by 2027. This move intensifies competition with Qualcomm, which currently supplies modems to Apple, and could impact other Apple suppliers like Skyworks Solutions and Qorvo. Apple has been developing its own modem technology since acquiring Intel's modem unit in 2019 and recently signed a deal with Broadcom for 5G radio frequency components.

title: NYC ad agencies Omnicom, Interpublic to form $30bn marketing powerhouse
summary: Omnicom is set to acquire Interpublic Group in a stock-for-stock deal, creating the world's largest advertising agency with combined annual revenue of almost $26bn and a market worth of over $30bn. The merger aims to accelerate innovation, leverage new technologies like AI, and achieve annual cost savings of $750m. The deal, which could face regulatory scrutiny, positions the combined entity, Omnicom, to better compete with tech giants and adapt to the evolving advertising landscape.

title: Taiwan Semiconductor Extends Lead As Top Chipmaker
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSM) has solidified its position as the top global wafer foundry, increasing its market share to 64.9% in Q3 2024 due to strong demand for smartphone products and high-performance computing. The company reported $23.5 billion in revenue, a 39% increase, driven by 3nm and 5nm technologies. This growth contrasts with Samsung's market share decline and highlights the rising demand for advanced chip technologies and the impact of U.S. chip subsidies on key players like TSM and GlobalFoundries.

title: Apple honors 2024 App Store Award winners
summary: Apple announced the winners of the 2024 App Store Awards, recognizing 17 apps and games for their exceptional user experiences, design, and innovation. The awards include categories for various Apple devices, the inaugural Apple Vision Pro category, and Cultural Impact winners, highlighting developers who have enriched users' lives and communities. The winning selections showcase the diverse opportunities available across the App Store and the Apple ecosystem.

title: Report: Apple working with Broadcom to develop custom chipset for AI
summary: Apple Inc. is reportedly collaborating with Broadcom Inc. to develop a custom server processor, codenamed “Baltra,” for AI features in its iOS operating system, with a targeted launch in 2026. This move aligns with Apple's strategy of using proprietary chips for on-device AI and Broadcom's expertise in semiconductor interconnect designs. The project likely leverages Broadcom's advanced packaging technologies for faster chip-to-chip communications.

title: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is favoured by institutional owners who hold 61% of the company
summary: Institutional investors hold 61% of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), making them the most powerful shareholder group with significant influence on the company's share price. The Vanguard Group, Inc. is the largest shareholder with 8.9% of shares, while insiders own less than 1% and the general public holds a 37% stake.

title: Broadcom ETFs Surge on Strong AI Demand
summary: Broadcom's shares surged by 20% following strong earnings and optimistic projections for its AI business, pushing its market cap past $1 trillion. This surge significantly boosted ETFs with large Broadcom holdings, such as the Defiance Daily Target 2X Long AVGO ETF (AVGX) and the iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX). The demand for Broadcom's custom AI chips, favored by major tech companies like Alphabet, Meta, and Apple, is seen as a key driver for its continued growth.

title: Broadcom's AI Chip Leadership Puts Pressure on Nvidia and Marvell, Analysts Say
summary: Broadcom's stock surged after reporting strong Q4 adjusted EPS results and raising its dividend, driven by its leadership in AI custom Application-Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs). Analysts upgraded Broadcom's price targets, highlighting its expanding AI opportunities and advanced 3nm silicon technology, which puts it ahead of competitors like Nvidia and Marvell. The company anticipates significant growth in its AI revenues, expecting to reach $30 billion by calendar 2027 based on strong demand from hyperscalers.

title: A new investment fund is saying ‘no’ to DEI-focused companies — and ‘yes’ to others
summary: Azoria, a new investment firm, is launching an ETF that will exclude S&P 500 companies with explicit racial and gender hiring targets. The firm believes companies hiring based on skill and ability will financially outperform those focused on DEI, citing examples like Best Buy and the underperformance of DEI-focused companies. Azoria aims to provide investors with a meritocracy-rooted alternative, investing in companies that abandon such hiring practices.

title: Victoria’s Secret Is PETA’s ‘Company of the Year’ for its Fabulously Innovative Feather-Free Fashion Show
summary: PETA has named Victoria’s Secret its 2024 Company of the Year for its innovative use of feather-free materials in its fashion show, showcasing vegan Angel wings made from 3-D printed materials, quilted satin, soda can tabs, and Swarovski crystals. This decision followed PETA's communication with the retailer about the cruelty involved in obtaining feathers from birds. The move is applauded by PETA as an example for designers and consumers to adopt animal-friendly practices in fashion.

title: Pattern Energy Announces Equity Investment from Consortium Headed by APG and ART
summary: Pattern Energy announced that a consortium led by APG Asset Management and Australian Retirement Trust will acquire Riverstone Holdings LLC’s equity stake in the company. This investment strengthens Pattern Energy's position, allowing it to advance its development pipeline of over 25-gigawatts of renewable energy and transmission projects. The transaction is expected to close in the first half of 2025.

title: Apple says it has told suppliers to stop buying minerals from Congo
summary: Apple has instructed its suppliers to halt the purchase of tin, tantalum, tungsten, and gold from the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda due to escalating conflict in the region. This decision comes in response to allegations from the Congolese government that Apple uses conflict minerals laundered through international supply chains. Apple strongly disputes these allegations.

title: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is a favorite amongst institutional investors who own 61%
summary: Institutional investors own 61% of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), making it a favored stock among this group. While this signifies credibility, the concentration of ownership among a few large investors means their trading actions can significantly impact the stock price. Insiders, despite owning less than 1%, hold a substantial dollar value in shares and have been recent sellers.

title: After Earnings, Is Broadcom Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Broadcom's third-quarter earnings report, released on December 12, 2024, has led Morningstar to raise its fair value estimate for the company's stock to $190 per share, up from $155, driven by an increased AI revenue growth forecast. Despite the upward revision, Morningstar now considers Broadcom's shares to be roughly fairly valued after a significant post-earnings jump, giving it a 2-star rating. The article highlights Broadcom's strong potential in AI chips, its wide economic moat from intangible assets and switching costs, and its financial strength, while also noting risks related to market cycles and supply chain reliance on Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing.

title: Jabil’s Winning Streak Begins: Market Bottom Set, Future in Focus
summary: Jabil's fiscal Q1 2025 report indicates that the company has hit its market bottom, with a strong outlook for future growth despite a top-line contraction. The company outperformed expectations for both revenue and earnings, providing optimistic guidance and benefiting from strength in cloud, data center, and digital commerce segments. Analyst and institutional investor trends are positive, supporting a potential new all-time high for the stock.

title: ‘Synaptics plans to assemble 10% chips in India’
summary: US semiconductor company Synaptics Inc. plans to assemble and package 10% of its chips in India by 2027 to diversify its supply chain and reduce reliance on China. The company will use an OSAT facility in Hyderabad and partner with embed UR to develop edge AI solutions, aiming for the process to begin in late 2025 or early 2026. This move also addresses concerns about proposed US tariffs and the need for supply chain alternatives.

title: Apple to see strong Christmas iPhone sales that launch a ‘renaissance of growth’
summary: Apple is projected to experience a renaissance of growth driven by strong iPhone sales during the holiday season, fueled by an estimated 300 million iPhones over four years old. This potential "supercycle" is expected to lead to significant upgrades to new AI-capable iPhones, especially in the key China market, and could propel Apple to a $4 trillion market cap.

title: Apple approaches $4 trillion valuation as investors bet on AI momentum
summary: Apple is nearing a $4 trillion market valuation, driven by investor enthusiasm for its AI enhancements, which are expected to boost iPhone sales. The company has outpaced Nvidia and Microsoft in this race, with a roughly 16% share jump since November adding about $500 billion to its market cap. Analysts anticipate a rebound in iPhone revenue in 2025 as Apple integrates generative AI technology across its devices.

title: Apple’s been on an uncommonly strong run. So a tough January could now be in the cards.
summary: Apple's stock has achieved a rare five-week streak of 2%-plus gains, a phenomenon that historically precedes a roughly 5% drop in the following month. Investors are advised to be cautious as this pattern suggests a potentially tough January for Apple shares. The stock's recent performance marks the first time in 14 years and very rarely in the company's 44-year public history that it has had such a strong, sustained run.

title: Jim Cramer on Apple Inc. (AAPL): ‘It Was The Dumb Money That Was Getting Out, Because Warren Buffett Or One Of His Assistants Made Us Nervous’
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) within the context of AI stocks and overall market performance in 2024. He highlighted that "dumb money" sold off Apple shares due to investor nervousness, potentially influenced by Warren Buffett, despite strong underlying sales. Cramer also offered trading advice for 2025, emphasizing the importance of not getting intoxicated by gains, having the fortitude to hold stocks during tough times, and carefully staging buy orders.

title: Growth ETFs Shaken Up as Tech Takes on Value Blush
summary: Growth ETFs like IVW are undergoing significant rebalancing as major tech companies such as Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, and Adobe are no longer considered pure growth stocks by S&P Global. This reclassification means investors will see a smaller allocation to these tech giants in growth ETFs and a larger presence of financial firms like Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase, which are now being given a "growth blush". The rebalancing also shifts tech's share in the S&P Value Index significantly, with these companies now having their weightings divided between growth and value characteristics based on S&P's multifactor analysis.

title: Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) Poised for Strong 2025 Growth with Custom AI Chips and Strategic Partnerships, Says William Blair
summary: Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) is anticipated to experience strong growth in 2025, driven by its custom AI chip development and strategic partnerships with major cloud customers, according to William Blair. The company recently surpassed a $1 trillion market cap and its CEO announced the development of custom AI chips with three large cloud clients. William Blair maintains an Outperform rating, expecting steady growth from existing partnerships and potential new clients like ByteDance, OpenAI, and Apple.

title: Apple class action allege App Store offers malicious crypto apps
summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Apple Inc., claiming the company authorized and maintained malicious crypto applications on its App Store, leading to the theft of consumers' personal financial assets. Plaintiffs allege Apple misrepresented the safety and legality of these apps, including Digicoins, SolLuna, and Forex5, which they assert were "spoofing" programs designed to steal account information. The lawsuit seeks to represent a nationwide class of consumers for alleged violations of California's Consumers Legal Remedies Act and Unfair Competition Law.

title: Large-Cap Tech Stocks Could Soar Again in 2025
summary: Large-cap tech stocks, particularly the Magnificent Seven, are expected to continue their dominance and strong performance in 2025, according to market observers. Despite concerns over valuations and regulation, their focus on innovation and diversification positions them for another banner year. ETFs like Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) and Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) offer efficient exposure to these high-performing companies for growth-focused portfolios.

title: Schwab Trading Activity Index™: December Score Edges Higher for Third Consecutive Month
summary: The Schwab Trading Activity Index™ (STAX) increased to 51.16 in December, marking its third consecutive monthly rise. Schwab clients net bought equities, adding exposure in Health Care and Energy sectors, while selling Information Technology and Communication Services. The report highlights market volatility, key economic data releases, and popular stocks bought and sold by Schwab clients throughout December and the entirety of 2024.

title: EWC, Canada ETFs Rise Amid Trudeau Resignation
summary: The iShares MSCI Canada ETF (EWC) rose following the announcement of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's resignation, citing a need for new leadership. The article also discusses why Canadian ETFs have historically lagged behind U.S. equity ETFs like SPY, attributing it to factors such as sector concentration, innovation, market size, currency effects, venture capital, and global influence.

title: Most of the ‘Sweet 16’ stocks have dominated. They might do it again in 2025.
summary: The article discusses the "Sweet 16" list of stocks, initially identified by Jefferies in September 2020, highlighting their significant contribution to the U.S. stock market's performance. It suggests that these stocks, including giants like Nvidia, are poised for continued revenue growth in 2025. The piece also mentions other groups of dominant stocks, such as "BATMMAAN," which includes Broadcom and the "Magnificent Seven."

title: Most of the ‘Sweet 16’ stocks have dominated. They might do it again in 2025.
summary: The article discusses the "Sweet 16" stocks identified by Jefferies in September 2020, highlighting their significant contribution to the US stock market's performance over the past five years. It suggests these stocks, including Nvidia, may continue their dominant trend into 2025 due to expected revenue growth. The piece also mentions other dominant stock groupings like "BATMMAAN" and the "Magnificent Seven."

title: Apple, Google And Meta Can't Escape Gambling Lawsuits, Judge Rejects Section 230 Shield In Landmark Ruling On Casino-Style Apps
summary: A federal judge has ruled that Apple, Google, and Meta must face lawsuits alleging they profited from illegal casino-style apps, rejecting their Section 230 defense. The companies are accused of hosting and promoting addictive gambling apps and taking 30% commissions on in-app purchases, with plaintiffs seeking compensatory damages for alleged addiction and its consequences. This ruling adds to the growing legal scrutiny faced by tech giants.

title: NYSEARCA:QYLD - High-Yield ETF with 12% Annual Income: Is It Still Worth It?
summary: The NYSEARCA:QYLD ETF provides a high annual yield exceeding 12% through a covered call strategy on NASDAQ 100 stocks, making it attractive for income-focused investors. However, this strategy caps upside potential, leading to significant underperformance compared to broader market indices and newer, more flexible alternatives like JEPQ. While it offers consistent monthly income, its long-term capital preservation issues and inability to fully capitalize on bull markets raise questions about its suitability for total return investors.

title: Should Invesco Dividend Achievers ETF (PFM) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The Invesco Dividend Achievers ETF (PFM) is a passively managed large-cap value ETF with $719.98 million in assets, sponsored by Invesco. Launched in 2005, it focuses on dividend-paying companies that have increased dividends for over 10 consecutive years, with top holdings including Broadcom, Apple, and Microsoft. PFM has a Zacks ETF Rank of 3 (Hold) and an expense ratio of 0.52%, and its performance has shown year-to-date gains of 2.90% and a 19.34% increase over the last year as of January 22, 2025.

title: IUSV: A Cost-Effective Value ETF With Strong Downside Protection And Growth Potential
summary: The iShares Core S&P U.S. Value ETF (IUSV) offers cost-efficient value investing with a portfolio of 700 U.S. large-cap and mid-cap value stocks and a low expense ratio of 0.04%. Its significant allocation to large-cap stocks and a 23% exposure to the technology sector, including Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon, contribute to strong downside protection and growth potential. IUSV has demonstrated superior performance, outperforming its peer IWD with a 167.2% total return over the past decade and 597.5% since inception.

title: Major San Francisco Union Square hotel to hit the market as part of $1B sale
summary: The Grand Hyatt San Francisco in Union Square is set to be put on the market by Host Hotels & Resorts Inc. as part of a larger $1 billion sale of West Coast properties. This divestment is consistent with Host's plan to offload "noncore" assets, including the 669-room hotel, which was acquired in a $1 billion three-hotel deal in 2018. The sale follows a recent strike by hotel workers and another significant change in San Francisco hotel ownership.

title: Apple Stock Is Off Its Recent Highs, But Is It Poised to Rise Again?
summary: Despite a recent dip from its highs, Apple (AAPL) stock is poised for a rise due to strong free cash flow results and high FCF margins. The company's conservative approach to capex spending and consistent shareholder returns, including significant share buybacks and dividends, contribute to its undervaluation. The article suggests strategies like selling out-of-the-money puts or buying in-the-money calls to capitalize on the expected upside.

title: Trump Pauses Tariffs on Mexico; DJIA Closes Down Only 122 Pts; Nasdaq Still Lags with 1%+ Drop
summary: US President Donald Trump postponed new tariffs on Mexico for a month after reaching an agreement on border troops, which slowed but didn't halt a stock market decline. The DJIA closed down 122 points, while the S&P 500 slipped 0.8% and the Nasdaq saw the steepest decline at 1.2%. The iShares MSCI Mexico ETF (EWW.US) rebounded, and major tech stocks like Tesla, Nvidia, and Apple saw losses narrow slightly.

title: BlackRock, Inc. Increases Stake in Compass Therapeutics Inc
summary: BlackRock, Inc. significantly increased its stake in Compass Therapeutics Inc by acquiring an additional 67,163 shares, bringing its total holdings to 6,887,615 shares. This move solidifies Compass Therapeutics as 5.00% of BlackRock's portfolio, reflecting the investment firm's strategic interest in the biopharmaceutical sector. Despite a GF Score of 43/100, indicating potential challenges, Compass Therapeutics' stock has seen a remarkable 115.17% gain since the transaction, driven by its innovative therapeutic pipeline.

title: 5 Charts on How Investors Are Addressing Race at Shareholder Meetings
summary: Investor engagement on race and ethnicity at shareholder meetings has evolved, with a significant increase in anti-DEI resolutions but consistently low support for them. While overall support for conventional resolutions addressing race has declined, there's a growing focus on workforce-related issues, aligning with broader human capital management trends. Requests for pay gap reports and anti-harassment efforts at major companies like Apple, Amazon, Nike, Oracle, and Tesla garnered significant shareholder backing in 2024.

title: BlackRock, Inc. Increases Stake in Tyler Technologies Inc
summary: BlackRock, Inc. increased its stake in Tyler Technologies Inc by acquiring an additional 713,164 shares, bringing its total holdings to over 4 million shares. This transaction, valued at $576.64 per share, reflects BlackRock's continued interest in the software industry and Tyler Technologies' strong growth potential, despite its current overvaluation according to GuruFocus. Other notable investors also hold positions in Tyler Technologies, highlighting broader market confidence in the government software solutions provider.

title: After a Dividend Increase, This Wide-Moat Stock Is a Buy
summary: Lockheed Martin recently increased its quarterly dividend by 5% and has a 22-year streak of dividend increases, making it an attractive investment despite recent cost overruns. The wide-moat aerospace and defense contractor is considered undervalued, benefiting from significant US defense spending and its dominant role in programs like the F-35 fighter jet. The stock's fair value is estimated at $530 per share, with projected revenue growth and strong economic moat factors.

title: PNC Financial Services Group, Inc. Reduces Stake in iShares MSCI Intl Quality Factor ETF
summary: PNC Financial Services Group, Inc. reduced its stake in the iShares MSCI Intl Quality Factor ETF (IQLT) by selling 13,971 shares at $37.12 each on December 31, 2024. Despite this reduction, PNC Financial Services Group maintains a significant holding of over 30 million IQLT shares, representing 0.72% of its portfolio. This strategic move aims to optimize its investment strategy and balance risk and return within its $149.56 billion equity portfolio.

title: 3 Reasons Vanguard’s VGT ETF Belongs in Your Portfolio
summary: The Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) is presented as a strong option for investors seeking aggressive tech exposure, especially in the growing AI boom. The article highlights three key advantages: its superior focus on tech compared to the Nasdaq 100, its heavy concentration in leading tech giants like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, and its competitive low expense ratio of 0.09%. These factors position VGT as a viable choice for future-proofing portfolios despite concerns about an overextended AI trade.

title: Major Aviation Merger: flyExclusive's $22M Strategic Takeover Reshapes Private Charter Market
summary: flyExclusive (NYSE: FLYX) is set to acquire Jet.AI's (NASDAQ: JTAI) aviation business for $12-22 million in an all-stock deal, transforming Jet.AI into a pure-play AI company. The transaction, expected to close in Q2 2025, involves spinning off Jet.AI's charter business into a new entity which flyExclusive will then acquire, while Jet.AI shareholders will retain their stock and receive new flyExclusive shares. This strategic move aims to provide flyExclusive with growth capital and enhanced shareholder liquidity, leveraging synergies between the two companies.

title: Roundhill Launches 5 Leveraged Weekly Income ETFs
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched five new WeeklyPay ETFs (NVW, TSW, AAPW, COIW, PLTW) on the Cboe Exchange, offering weekly distributions and leveraged exposure to specific single stocks like Nvidia, Tesla, and Apple. These actively managed funds aim to generate 1.2 times the weekly returns of their underlying companies, providing income-focused investors with amplified returns and potential tax advantages through return of capital distributions. This innovation expands Roundhill's portfolio of weekly income strategies, with plans for additional leveraged WeeklyPay ETFs covering other major companies.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Offloads Meta Shares Worth $14.4 Million In February
summary: Mark Zuckerberg sold 17,855 shares of Meta Platforms Inc. Class A common stock worth approximately $14.4 million on February 14, at prices between $726.68 and $740.71. These transactions were executed under a pre-established trading plan and follow previous sales in late December 2024. Despite these sales, Meta demonstrates strong financial health with a high gross profit margin and increased quarterly dividends.

title: Berkshire’s Earnings: Diamond Hands or Paper Hands?
summary: This article examines the upcoming Berkshire Hathaway earnings report in late February, outlining both bullish and bearish catalysts for its stock (BRK.B). It highlights Berkshire's strategic investments, record cash reserves, and strong operating businesses as bullish factors, while portfolio reductions in Apple and Bank of America, legal challenges, and leadership transition uncertainty are identified as bearish concerns. The article emphasizes Berkshire's role as a diversified, non-tech investment with exposure to financials, energy, and industrials, suggesting that the earnings call will provide critical insights into its future direction.

title: What's Going On With FiscalNote Holdings Stock Monday?
summary: FiscalNote Holdings Inc (NYSE: NOTE) saw its shares trading higher after announcing a definitive agreement to divest two non-core assets, Oxford Analytica and Dragonfly, to Dow Jones for $40 million. This move is expected to reduce the company's senior term loan, strengthen its balance sheet, and streamline operations, focusing on core Policy solutions. Additionally, FiscalNote engaged John Lee, former head of contracts for Palantir’s U.S. government vertical, as a senior strategic advisor to support its AI and data-driven solutions for the public sector.

title: Why FCF ETF 'VFLO' Looks Strong in 2025
summary: The VictoryShares Free Cash Flow ETF (VFLO) demonstrated strong demand in 2024 and is well-positioned for 2025, offering diversification, attractive valuations, and strong historical returns. VFLO targets large-cap U.S. companies with high free cash flow yields, excluding "Magnificent Seven" stocks, making it a valuable complement to broad benchmarks. Its performance in 2024, generating a nearly 22% return, highlights its potential to improve value exposure in portfolios.

title: Rockwell Automation Poised to Gain From U.S. Tariffs & Onshoring
summary: Rockwell Automation stands to benefit significantly from U.S. tariffs and the growing trend of onshoring manufacturing back to the United States. The company, which produces industrial automation equipment and has over 70% of its products "Made in America," is well-positioned to capitalize on increased domestic production spurred by trade policies. Despite conservative guidance, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating, anticipating that Rockwell will mitigate tariff impacts and emerge as a net beneficiary.

title: Live Nation Loses Bid to Narrow DOJ Ticketmaster Case
summary: A federal judge in New York denied Live Nation Entertainment Inc.'s attempt to narrow the Justice Department’s antitrust case against it, which seeks to break off Ticketmaster. The DOJ and some 30 states allege Live Nation has illegally monopolized the live events industry, controlling a significant portion of concert venues and ticketing. A trial is scheduled for March 2026.

title: US Vs. Europe ETFs: Is The Tide Turning?
summary: European equities have notably outperformed U.S. equities since the beginning of 2025, leading to a shift in investor sentiment, with European investors pulling out of U.S. equity ETFs. This divergence is attributed to geopolitical developments, China's economic rebound supporting European exports, and concerns over U.S. mega-cap tech valuations and tariffs. Despite these shifts, both U.S. and European ETF markets are experiencing robust growth, although European ETFs have grown faster due to lower percentages of registered funds historically.

title: Deadline Alert: Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (SWKS) Investors Who Lost Money Urged To Contact Glancy Prongay & Murray LLP About Securities Fraud Lawsuit
summary: Glancy Prongay & Murray LLP is reminding investors of Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ: SWKS) who suffered losses to contact them regarding a securities fraud lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges that Skyworks made misleading statements about its business operations and prospects, particularly concerning its relationship with Apple and its ability to capitalize on AI. Investors who purchased Skyworks securities between July 30, 2024, and February 5, 2025, have until May 5, 2025, to file a lead plaintiff motion.

title: 4 tech giants look cheap ahead of earnings
summary: Ahead of their earnings reports, four major tech companies—Apple, Amazon, Facebook, and Microsoft—are considered undervalued. Analysts see Apple as undervalued despite recent revenue guidance adjustments, Amazon as continuing its impressive growth, Microsoft showing broad-based strength, and Facebook maintaining its competitive advantages in digital advertising despite recent controversies.

title: Trump tally: J&J plans $55 billion investment to expand U.S. manufacturing
summary: Johnson & Johnson announced a $55 billion investment over the next four years to expand U.S. manufacturing, research, and technology. This move aligns with President Trump's goal of boosting domestic manufacturing and will include new facilities and expansions to existing sites. J&J's investment is part of a larger trend of major U.S. companies pledging significant spending to expand U.S. operations.

title: ACV Auctions CEO George Chamoun sells $5.37 million in stock
summary: George Chamoun, CEO of ACV Auctions Inc. (NASDAQ: ACVA), sold 350,000 shares of Class A Common Stock worth approximately $5.37 million across two transactions on March 19 and 20. The sales were conducted under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan established in December 2024. Following these sales, Chamoun retains 2,821,193 shares.

title: Worried About the Markets? This Tech ETF Is Up Over 25% This Year and Could Still Go Higher.
summary: The Invesco China Technology ETF (CQQQ) has surged over 25% this year, outperforming the S&P 500 and the broader tech sector, driven by advancements in Chinese AI. Despite recent market downturns and concerns over tech valuations, this ETF offers exposure to undervalued Chinese tech companies with significant growth potential, especially in the AI sector. With a forward price-to-earnings multiple of just 19, it presents a compelling investment opportunity.

title: Digging into Berkshire Hathaway’s portfolio
summary: This article analyzes Berkshire Hathaway's equity portfolio using Morningstar's Global Risk Model, uncovering its concentrated and evolving nature. Despite Buffett's historical aversion to tech, the portfolio is now notably technology-focused, primarily due to its significant Apple holding. The analysis highlights how Berkshire's investment strategy, though idiosyncratic, shows unique characteristics in liquidity, momentum, moat, value-growth, and volatility compared to the S&P 500.

title: BCX: Examining Inflation Protection Benefits And Recession Risks
summary: The BlackRock Resources & Commodities Strategy Trust (BCX) is a closed-end fund offering commodities exposure and a high income yield, making it attractive for inflation protection. The fund has historically performed well during inflationary periods, outperforming the S&P 500 year-to-date, and trades at a compelling discount to NAV with a significant yield and monthly distributions. While distributions have been fully covered year-to-date, they were not fully covered for the full year 2024.

title: PTC Brings AI-Powered PLM to Hannover Messe 2025 with Windchill AI
summary: PTC is set to preview its AI-powered Windchill AI product lifecycle management (PLM) assistant at Hannover Messe 2025, alongside Codebeamer AI and ServiceMax AI. This initiative demonstrates PTC's commitment to advancing agentic AI across the product digital thread, aiming to enhance engineers' efficiency by leveraging product data for informed decision-making and task automation. The preview will include the Document Vault AI agent, designed to extract critical product information from Windchill-stored documents.

title: Rob Arnott on Deep Value and ‘Running Towards Lions’
summary: Rob Arnott, founder of Research Affiliates, discusses his deep-value NIXT ETF which invests in underperforming, deleted stocks, aiming to capitalize on their greater upside potential compared to frothy, expensive additions to indexes. He emphasizes the importance of diversification into cheap alternatives, even if uncomfortable, and views the financial advisor's role as guiding clients away from "stupid mistakes" like performance chasing.

title: Visa CEO Ryan McInerney sells $3 million in stock
summary: Visa CEO Ryan McInerney sold 8,620 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $3.02 million. This transaction occurred under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan and near Visa's 52-week high. The article also highlights Visa's strong performance, its bid to replace Mastercard for Apple's credit card, and efforts to integrate with cryptocurrency wallets and combat scams.

title: Growth or Bubble? Decoding the Rapid Rise of CXAI Stock
summary: CXApp Inc. (CXAI) stock is experiencing a significant rise, up 32.54%, driven by positive market sentiment and strategic advancements including the appointment of Terry Blanchard as SVP of Engineering. The company faces financial challenges, as shown by its Q3 2024 operating revenue of $1.897M against $5.223M in total expenses, but maintains a strong gross margin of 80.9%. The market awaits its rescheduled Q4 and FY24 earnings call for further insights into its AI-native platform and future trajectory.

title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai sells $5.15 million in company stock
summary: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai recently sold approximately $5.15 million in company stock through a pre-established trading plan. The sales occurred while Alphabet's stock traded near its 52-week low, though Wall Street maintains a bullish outlook. Pichai's remaining direct holdings in Alphabet amount to over 2.7 million shares.

title: LANDSEA HOMES CLOSES ON 78 HOMESITES IN THE MOONLIGHT MASTER- PLANNED COMMUNITY IN MARICOPA, ARIZONA
summary: Landsea Homes (Nasdaq: LSEA) announced it has closed on 78 homesites in the Moonlight master-planned community in Maricopa, Arizona. The company plans to offer single- and two-story homes featuring High Performance Home features including smart home automation technology (Apple Home™ environment) and energy savings. This expansion aims to meet the demand for quality, energy-efficient homes in the fast-growing Maricopa area, with sales expected to launch this summer.

title: LANDSEA HOMES CLOSES ON 78 HOMESITES IN THE MOONLIGHT MASTER- PLANNED COMMUNITY IN MARICOPA, ARIZONA
summary: Landsea Homes Corporation announced it has closed on 78 homesites in the Moonlight master-planned community in Maricopa, Arizona. The company will offer High Performance single- and two-story homes ranging from 1,332 to 2,624 square feet, with sales expected to launch this summer. These homes will feature smart home automation technology integrated with the Apple Home™ environment and energy-saving features.

title: Why iShares China Large-Cap ETF (FXI) Is Falling
summary: The iShares China Large-Cap ETF (FXI) experienced a significant decline due to escalating U.S.-China trade tensions. New tariffs imposed by the U.S. and China's firm stance on retaliatory duties, along with export controls on rare earth minerals, have made investors wary of weakened growth prospects. The ETF, which tracks top Chinese firms like Alibaba and JD.Com, is also vulnerable to supply chain disruptions and concerns over a global recession.

title: ROSEN, TRUSTED INVESTOR COUNSEL, Encourages Skyworks Solutions, Inc. Investors to Secure Counsel Before Important Deadline in Securities Class Action - SWKS
summary: Rosen Law Firm is encouraging investors of Skyworks Solutions, Inc. (NASDAQ: SWKS) to secure counsel before the May 5, 2025 lead plaintiff deadline in a securities class action lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges that Skyworks Solutions made materially false and misleading statements regarding its revenue expectations, its relationship with Apple, and its ability to capitalize on AI in smartphones during the Class Period of July 30, 2024, to February 5, 2025. Investors who purchased Skyworks securities during this period may be entitled to compensation without out-of-pocket fees.

title: 3 High-Value Companies With Triple-Digit Upside Potential
summary: Following an early April market selloff, several companies are presenting as undervalued investment opportunities. This article highlights three specific firms—Impinj (PI), Northern Technologies International (NTIC), and Seadrill (SDRL)—that experienced significant share price declines but possess strong growth potential due to improving fundamentals, new partnerships, or substantial backlogs. Each company presents a case for bullish investors to consider at their current comparably low price points, with analysts projecting triple-digit upside potential for some.

title: Mitigating Tariffs: 3 Stocks to Gain From a Weaker U.S. Dollar
summary: This article identifies three stocks — Coca-Cola, Apple, and Caterpillar — that could benefit significantly from a weaker U.S. dollar, counteracting the effects of tariffs. A weaker dollar makes U.S. products cheaper for international buyers, potentially increasing demand and turning currency headwinds into tailwinds for companies with substantial overseas revenue. The author explains how companies often report "currency headwinds" but that a weaker dollar can lead to higher sales volumes abroad despite lower margins.

title: Why Fidelity’s Dividend ETF (FDVV) Is a Safe Haven in Today’s Market
summary: The Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV) offers investors a blend of safety and income through exposure to diversified large-cap dividend-paying businesses. Its significant yield of 3.28% and relative resilience make it attractive for those seeking compounding opportunities and portfolio growth, especially in uncertain economic times. With a low expense ratio of 0.16%, FDVV provides a cost-effective way to invest in established companies that can withstand market volatility.

title: The Magnificent Seven receives another ETF focused on covered calls
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched a new exchange-traded fund, the Roundhill Magnificent Seven Covered Call ETF (MAGY), which focuses on covered calls for the mega-cap tech stocks known as the Magnificent Seven. This actively managed ETF is the latest financial product inspired by the strong performance of these prominent technology companies.

title: Is Occidental Petroleum Corp (OXY) the Best Stock to Buy According to Billionaire Warren Buffett?
summary: This article examines Occidental Petroleum Corp (OXY) as a top holding in Warren Buffett's portfolio, detailing his increased stake and the company's financial performance. It discusses Buffett's investment philosophy and OXY's operations, including its recent acquisition of CrownRock and expansion into carbon capture. Despite OXY's strong position with Buffett, the article also presents a counter-argument from Jim Cramer and suggests superior prospects in certain AI stocks.

title: BlackRock, Inc. Reduces Stake in The Interpublic Group of Compan
summary: BlackRock, Inc. significantly reduced its stake in The Interpublic Group of Companies Inc by selling over 5.6 million shares at $27.16 each. This transaction, part of BlackRock's portfolio management strategy, decreased its holding in IPG to 10.70% of its total shares in the company. IPG, a global advertising leader with a market cap of $9.38 billion, is considered modestly undervalued according to GF Value and recently entered a merger agreement with Omnicom.

title: 3 Reasons Every Investor Should Own Fidelity’s FTEC ETF
summary: The article advocates for investors to own Fidelity's FTEC ETF due to its diversified exposure to the information technology sector, significant growth potential, and stability derived from its broad diversification. FTEC offers immediate access to major tech firms, boasts 143% returns over five years, and maintains a moderate expense ratio and volatility compared to the S&P 500. Its portfolio of 283 stocks helps mitigate risks associated with individual company performance.

title: As Investors Brace for Volatility, Look to Dividend ETF FDVV
summary: Given current market uncertainties like sticky inflation, high interest rates, and geopolitical tensions, many investors anticipate continued volatility. Dividend ETFs, such as the Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV), offer a potential solution for stability and income generation. FDVV invests in large- and mid-cap dividend-paying companies and can provide diversification benefits, offering a consistent revenue stream that can help offset market volatility.

title: Google's parent company Alphabet shares plunge over 8% amid AI search competition, malware threats
summary: Alphabet Inc. shares dropped over 8% following revelations from an antitrust trial, citing increased AI search competition and new malware threats. Apple executive Eddy Cue testified about declining Google search traffic due to AI alternatives and announced future AI choices in Safari. Google also disclosed a new malware strain, LOSTKEYS, linked to a Russian hacking group, and partnered with Elementl Power to build nuclear plants to power AI data centers, addressing the anticipated surge in electricity usage.

title: Alphabet: Testimony From Apple Search Executive Rattles Investors
summary: Apple's Eddy Cue testified in the DOJ lawsuit against Alphabet, indicating Apple may end its long-term Google Search partnership for Safari. This news caused investor concern, given Google's significant revenue-sharing agreement with Apple. Despite potential changes and AI's impact on search, Morningstar maintains its fair value estimate for Alphabet, believing the market's reaction is overblown and that Google will adapt with AI-infused offerings.

title: Is SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS), launched on April 15, 2015, offers exposure to the Style Box - Large Cap Blend category with a smart beta strategy. Managed by State Street Global Advisors, it has over $1.49 billion in assets and seeks to match the performance of the MSCI USA Factor Mix A-Series Index, with an expense ratio of 0.15%. The ETF's top holdings include Apple Inc., Microsoft Corp, and Meta Platforms Inc., and it has shown strong performance, adding 2.29% year-to-date and 11.24% over the last 12 months as of May 13, 2025.

title: Here’s Why Every Investor Should Consider Vanguard’s VIG ETF
summary: The Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG) is a compelling investment for stability, growth, and income, especially in volatile markets. Launched in 2006, VIG tracks the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index, holding 338 stocks of companies with a decade-long record of dividend increases, excluding high-yield stocks to avoid yield traps. With a low expense ratio of 0.05% and strong performance, VIG offers a diversified, low-cost, and resilient option for investors seeking long-term financial success through dividend growth.

title: The Best ETFs for Tech Stock Investors | Morningstar Europe
summary: The technology sector experienced a recovery in early 2025 following a challenging start, driven by positive earnings and a China trade deal. Morningstar identifies seven highly-rated ETFs, including offerings from Xtrackers, iShares, SPDR, and Amundi, that provide investors with exposure to this rebounding sector. These ETFs are highlighted for their potential to outperform, with detailed performance metrics provided for the largest strategies.

title: Is iShares Paris-Aligned Climate MSCI USA ETF (PABU) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The iShares Paris-Aligned Climate MSCI USA ETF (PABU), launched on April 8, 2022, is a smart beta ETF focused on the Style Box - All Cap Blend category, aiming to align with Paris Agreement objectives through decarbonization and reduced climate-related risks. With over $2.12 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.10%, PABU primarily invests in Information Technology, with Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft as top holdings. The ETF has shown strong performance, up 13.72% over the last year, offering a diversified option for investors in climate-aligned strategies.

title: Cell Phone Satisfaction Hits Decade Low Mark as AI Promises Fall Short, ACSI Data Show
summary: User satisfaction with cell phones has dropped to a decade-low of 78, according to the American Customer Satisfaction Index (ACSI), despite new AI features. The study indicates that customers prioritize fundamental aspects like battery life, call reliability, and ease of use over advanced capabilities. This decline extends to wireless phone and internet service providers, with smartwatch satisfaction also sensitive to basic features.

title: Should iShares Russell 1000 ETF (IWB) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 ETF (IWB) is a passively managed fund designed for exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market, with assets over $40.09 billion and an expense ratio of 0.15%. It primarily allocates to Information Technology, Financials, and Consumer Discretionary, with Microsoft, Apple, and Nvidia as top holdings. The ETF has shown positive year-to-date and one-year performance and holds a Zacks ETF Rank of "Buy" due to its low costs, diversification, and alignment with market trends.

title: Big Mag 7 Rally Pays Off for QBIG
summary: The Invesco Top QQQ ETF (QBIG), holding Magnificent Seven stocks and Broadcom, has seen a 16% gain in the month ending May 15, outperforming the S&P 500 Growth Index. This rebound is attributed to clearer international trade policy and potential AI advancements, despite the ETF still being in the red year-to-date. A recent thaw in U.S./China trade relations also bodes well for QBIG’s holdings.

title: Canadian Stocks Reached An All-Time High This Week
summary: Canadian stocks have recently hit an all-time high despite prevailing fears of a recession and political uncertainties, driven by strong performances in financial, technology, and defensive sectors. The author emphasizes that rather than attempting to time the market, investors should adhere to a disciplined investment strategy and embrace volatility to build long-term wealth. For stability amidst economic uncertainty, especially for retirees, the article suggests a diversified global portfolio that includes U.S., international, and Canadian equities, focusing on defensive sectors and wide-moat Canadian stocks.

title: Volatility ETFs Spike on Renewed Trump Tariff Threats
summary: Volatility Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) have seen a spike following renewed threats of tariffs from former President Donald Trump on EU goods and imported smartphones. This surge in volatility is also exacerbated by worries over a ballooning U.S. deficit and a Moody's credit rating downgrade. Investors are warned that these volatility products are generally suitable only for short-term traders due to contango issues, but current market conditions may present a temporary opportunity.

title: Maplebear Inc. appoints new CEO and expands share buyback
summary: Maplebear Inc. (Instacart) has announced Chris Rogers as its new CEO and President, effective August 15, 2025, succeeding Fidji Simo, who will remain as Chair of the Board. The company also expanded its share repurchase program authorization to $1 billion from $750 million. These changes come amid positive financial performance and analyst upgrades for the company.

title: Will the MAG 7 Stocks Continue to Lead the Stock Market?
summary: The article discusses the continued influence of the "Magnificent Seven" (MAG 7) stocks—Microsoft, NVIDIA, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Tesla—on the US stock market. It highlights their market capitalization leadership and their resilience following a market correction caused by tariff fears. The author suggests that the MAGS ETF offers a diversified way to invest in these leading technology companies and expects them to maintain their market leadership.

title: Should SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The article analyzes the SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS), highlighting its suitability for investors seeking exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market. It details the ETF's low expense ratio, sector allocation (heavily in Information Technology), top holdings like Microsoft, Apple, and Meta, and its performance and risk profile. The article concludes that QUS is a good option for specific market exposure and suggests alternatives like SPY and VOO.

title: Alumni Spotlight: Kate Pytlewski
summary: This article spotlights Kate Pytlewski, VP, Deputy General Counsel at EPAM Systems, Inc., highlighting her career progression from an associate at Faegre Drinker to her current leadership role. She discusses the challenges and rewards of in-house counsel work, particularly navigating global crises, and reflects on her positive experiences and mentorship at Faegre Drinker. Pytlewski also shares her thoughts on artificial intelligence in the legal industry and her personal interests and future plans.

title: GlobalFoundries Announces $16B U.S. Investment to Reshore Essential Chip Manufacturing and Accelerate AI Growth
summary: GlobalFoundries (GF) announced a $16 billion investment to expand its semiconductor manufacturing and advanced packaging capabilities across its facilities in New York and Vermont. This strategic investment is backed by major tech companies like Apple, SpaceX, AMD, Qualcomm, NXP, and GM, and aims to reshore essential chip manufacturing to the U.S., accelerating innovation in AI-enabling and power-efficient technologies. The investment supports the explosive growth in AI and strengthens the domestic semiconductor supply chain and leadership.

title: 2 Unstoppable ETFs for Growth Investors to Buy and Hold for Years
summary: This article highlights two ETFs, the iShares Exponential Technologies ETF (XT) and Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), as promising long-term investments for growth investors. XT diversifies across global innovation leaders with a modest expense ratio, while QQQ tracks the top 100 non-financial Nasdaq stocks, offering higher concentration in influential tech giants like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple. Both ETFs are presented as "buy and forget" options for potentially market-beating returns.

title: MSTY vs. SPYI: Insane Dividend Yields or Tax-Smart Income—Which Wins?
summary: This article compares two dividend ETFs, MSTY and SPYI, for passive income investors. MSTY offers an astounding 94.37% distribution rate but has a higher expense ratio and is tied to MicroStrategy stock, while SPYI provides more diversification, a lower expense ratio, tax advantages, and a 12.5% distribution rate. The choice between them depends on an investor's tolerance for volatility, tax considerations, and preference for ultra-high yield versus diversified, steady income.

title: Serviços Apple oferecem recursos poderosos e atualizações inteligentes ainda este ano
summary: A Apple anunciou uma série de novos recursos e atualizações inteligentes para seus serviços, que serão lançados com o iOS 26 e outros sistemas operacionais ainda este ano. As novidades incluem AutoMix no Apple Music, rotas favoritas e Locais Visitados no Mapas da Apple, rastreamento de pedidos com Apple Intelligence na Carteira da Apple, e a introdução da Identidade digital. Essas atualizações visam tornar o dia a dia dos usuários mais prático, divertido e personalizado.

title: Qualcomm to acquire Alphawave Semi for $2.4B
summary: Qualcomm has agreed to acquire Alphawave Semi for $2.4 billion, aiming to strengthen its position in the artificial intelligence and data center markets. This acquisition is part of Qualcomm's broader strategy to enhance its product capabilities for next-generation technologies and expand into new markets. The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of 2026 and will provide Qualcomm with Alphawave's high-speed connectivity and compute silicon assets.

title: This Gen X CEO runs Eventbrite, the ticketing platform that has sold over two billion tickets—she loves Legos, hypnotherapy, and skin-care gadgets
summary: This article profiles Julia Hartz, co-founder and CEO of Eventbrite, detailing her career trajectory from MTV and FX to leading a global ticketing platform. It explores her personal interests, financial habits, and work-life balance while managing a successful company and raising four daughters. The piece offers a glimpse into how a C-suite executive spends her time and money outside of work, including her love for Legos, hypnotherapy, and innovative skin-care gadgets.

title: How to Buy Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO)
summary: This guide details how to invest in the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), one of the largest and most popular ETFs, known for its low expense ratio (0.03%) and its goal to match the S&P 500 index returns. It covers VOO's holdings, reasons to invest or not invest, its dividend payments, and historical performance. The article also provides a step-by-step guide to buying shares through a brokerage account.

title: Apple supplier Jabil plans $500M venture for AI infrastructure
summary: Jabil, an electronics component maker and Apple supplier, is investing $500 million over the next several years to expand its cloud and artificial intelligence data center infrastructure in the Southeastern U.S. This investment includes large-scale production facilities expected to be operational by mid-2026. The move aligns with similar U.S. infrastructure investments by tech giants like Apple, Nvidia, and Foxconn, aimed at strengthening domestic manufacturing and diversifying Jabil's commercial portfolio to meet surging AI infrastructure demand.

title: Texas Instruments injects $60B into U.S. chip manufacturing
summary: Texas Instruments announced a $60 billion plan to bolster domestic semiconductor manufacturing across seven facilities in Utah and Texas, marking the largest effort by a single U.S. company. This investment aims to create a domestic supply chain for chips used in various electronics and is expected to generate 60,000 new U.S. jobs through partnerships with companies like Nvidia, Apple, Ford, and SpaceX. While the initiative is substantial for the semiconductor supply, industry analysts note that realizing gains from increased manufacturing will take time.

title: Texas Instruments Partners With Apple, NVIDIA in Historic $60B US Semiconductor Expansion
summary: Texas Instruments (TXN) announced a historic investment of over $60 billion in seven U.S. semiconductor fabs across three mega-sites in Texas and Utah. This expansion, the largest of its kind in U.S. history, will create more than 60,000 U.S. jobs and produce foundational analog and embedded processing chips essential for various electronic devices. TI has also strengthened partnerships with major companies like Apple, Ford, Medtronic, NVIDIA, and SpaceX, showcasing a commitment to securing domestic supply chains and advancing American innovation.

title: Forget Monthly Dividends, These 5 ETFs Pay Investors Every Week
summary: This article highlights several ETFs that offer weekly dividend payments, catering to investors seeking regular income. It details specific ETFs like AAPL WeeklyPay (AAPW), NVDA WeeklyPay (NVDW), PLTR WeeklyPay (PLTW), TSLA WeeklyPay (TSLW), and the Weekly T-Bill ETF (WEEK), outlining their expense ratios, distribution rates, and underlying investments, which often include swap agreements and major tech stocks. The article also mentions the YieldMax AI & Tech Portfolio Option Income ETF (GPTY) as another option for weekly income.

title: Accenture is worst-performing stock in the S&P 500 on Friday
summary: Accenture became the worst-performing stock in the S&P 500 on Friday, despite reporting strong revenue and profits, along with optimistic guidance. The decline was attributed to investors' concerns over a 6% decrease in third-quarter bookings, which totaled $19.7 billion. Shares of Accenture PLC Class A were down 8.2% and on pace for their biggest drop since March 2024, having fallen 20% year-to-date.

title: Texas Instruments to Put $60 Billion Toward Semiconductor Manufacturing in North Texas
summary: Texas Instruments plans to invest over $60 billion in semiconductor manufacturing, establishing "mega-sites" in Sherman, Richardson, and Lehi, Utah, which is expected to create over 60,000 jobs. This investment is supported by the Trump administration to boost American manufacturing and involves partnerships with major companies like Apple, Ford, Medtronic, NVIDIA, and SpaceX. Additionally, the article covers BGSF's sale of its professional division for $99 million and the upcoming opening of Flight Club, a social entertainment concept, in Addison.

title: Texas Instruments plans to invest $60B in semiconductor fabs
summary: Texas Instruments announced plans to invest over $60 billion in seven semiconductor fabrication plants across Texas and Utah, marking one of the largest investments in the sector. This investment will significantly increase U.S. manufacturing capacity for 300mm chips, supported by $1.6 billion in funding from the CHIPS and Science Act, and will create more than 60,000 new jobs. The new fabs will produce chips for major companies like Apple, Ford, Medtronic, and Nvidia, enhancing the country's position in advanced semiconductor technology.

title: Duolingo director hacker sells $4.7m in stock
summary: Severin Hacker, Duolingo's Chief Tech Officer and Director, sold 9,000 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $4.7 million on June 20, 2025, while also exercising options to acquire 10,000 shares. This comes as Duolingo's stock experienced a decline due to Apple's new Live Translation feature, though analysts like JPMorgan, DA Davidson, and Scotiabank have raised price targets citing strong user growth and monetization strategies.

title: Playstudios's agena sells $57,576 in stock By Investing.com
summary: Joel Agena, General Counsel at Playstudios, Inc., sold 40,980 shares of Class A Common Stock for a total of $57,576 in two transactions on June 20 and June 23, 2025. These sales were executed under a pre-arranged Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. Despite the insider sale, PlayStudios has recently received analyst upgrades from Craig-Hallum and Benchmark, citing optimism for new product offerings and a strong balance sheet.

title: It’s official: T-Mobile has the best network in America
summary: T-Mobile has officially been named the best mobile network in America by Ookla, a global leader in connectivity intelligence, marking a significant milestone after 12 years of investment and innovation. The company is celebrating by launching its T-Satellite service commercially on July 23rd, offering satellite-to-mobile connectivity, and providing a free year of DashPass by DoorDash to most of its customers starting July 8th. T-Mobile is also introducing an "Easy Upgrade" program to entice AT&T and Verizon customers to switch to its network.

title: IVE ETF: How It Tracks the S&P 500 Value Index
summary: The iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) is a popular choice for investors seeking exposure to large-cap US value stocks. This article explains how IVE tracks the S&P 500 Value Index using a passive, full replication strategy with periodic rebalancing, highlighting its cost-efficiency and diversification benefits. Key features, top holdings, and performance data are provided to assist traders in understanding its role in portfolio construction.

title: APLY vs. SCHD: Apple’s Mega Yield ETF or Dividend Aristocrat Power
summary: This article compares two ETFs, YieldMax AAPL Option Income Strategy ETF (APLY) and Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD), for passive income investors.
